repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Filippo Tommaso Marinetti Papers consist of correspondence, writings, photographs, printed items, diaries and memorabilia documenting and relating to the work of Marinetti and to the Futurist art movement.

langmaterial.language: Materials in Italian, French and English.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Filippo Tommaso Marinetti Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Filippo Tommaso Marinetti Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 57: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid, created before the advent of computer-generated files has been converted into a ASCII data file by means of scanning and Optical Character Recognition software. While attempts have been made to retain the complete information from the original document a number of format changes have been made to present the structure of this archive in accordance with current practice.

bioghist.head: FILIPPO TOMMASO MARINETTI (1876-1944)
bioghist.p: Filippo Tommaso Marinetti (1876-1944), Italian writer, founder of Futurism and its leader.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Filippo Tommaso Marinetti Papers consist of correspondence, writings, photographs, printed items, diaries and memorabilia documenting and relating to the work of Marinetti and to the Futurist art movement.

Organized into ten series: I. Letters by Filippo Tommaso Marinetti, 1909-1944. II. Letters by Benedetta Cappa Marinetti, 1921-1944. III. Letters to and about Filippo Tommaso Marinetti, 1989-1970. IV. Writings by Filippo Tommaso Marinetti, 1895-1944. V. Writings of Others, 1900-1961. VI. Manifestos [cataloged separately]. VII. Catalogues [cataloged separately]. VIII. Photographs, 1888-1944. IX. Clippings, 1914-1983. X. Special Files, 1918-1940.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unless otherwise indicated, all letters are ALS (autograph letter signed).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Boxes 2-9 contain letters, mostly undated, from Marinetti to his wife Benedetta. The letters are in the order in which BCM preserved them

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1) "Oggi verrà innalzata in Piazza Adriana la più grande bandiera del mondo", Il Tevere (Rome) 4 Nov 1933. 2) "La più grande bandiera del mondo", (photograph eith caption), Il Piccolo (Rome) 4 Nov 1933. 3) "La bandiera più grande del mondo alla I Mostra d'Arte futurista" (photograph), Il Messaggero (Rome) 6 Nov 1933. 4) "La più grande...", (photograph with caption), L'Ambrosiano (Milan) 4 Nov 1933. 5) "Marinetti," by Alfredo Panzini, Corriere della Sera 8 Nov 1933.

Autograph manuscript in an unidentified hand, with corrections by FTM. Labelled by FTM at the top of p. 1, 'Dall'Alcova d'Acciaio'. This fragment corresponds to Chapter XX, 'Le forze della gioia, della pietà e della vendetta', of L'Alcova d'Acciaio (Milan, Casa Editrice Vitagliano, 1921). MS pp. 1-6 (line 11) are the published pp. [237]-239 (line 3); MS pp. 6 (line 13) - 12 are the published pp. 241-243 (line 11). 12 p.

Proof of fourth edition, Paris, E. Sansot & Cie, 1908. With corrections by FTM. 170 p., numbered by printers 2-190 with first seven pages unnumbered, missing pages 12, 13, 25, 35, 42, 43, 53, 59, 74, 75, 85, 95, 103, 112, 113, 118, 119, 128, 129, 141, 153, 160, 161, 168, 169, 183, 187.

Proof of fourth edition, Paris, E. Sansot & Cie, 1908. A later proof than IV.5.2. With corrections by FTM. Numbered by printers 4-192 with first nine pages unnumbered. Numbering of pages in this edition is different from IV.5.2; pages correspond in this edition to earlier one but numbers are 2 higher: i.e. p. 25 in earlier proof equals p. 27 in this one. Missing pages 14, 15, 27, 37, 44, 45, 55, 61, 76, 77, 87, 97, 105, 114, 115, 120, 121, 130, 131, 143, 155, 162, 163, 170, 171, 185, 190.

Autograph manuscript account of a discussion between FTM and the poet Poliansky at a conference in Paris on futurism and fascism. In an unidentified hand. Sketches on the versos of pages 3-8. Dated at the top of page 1, Paris le 28 oct 1925. In French. 8 p., numbered 1-8. Accompanied by a photocopy of the publication of this dialogue in Zenit , Nov-Dec 1925.
Les dieux s'en vont, D'Annunzio reste

Autograph manuscript. The first 22 pages are taken from a printed book and pasted on larger sheets the same size as FTM's. Ms. Divided into sections, each with its own pagination, and labeled by letters, apparently not in a specific order. 92 p., numbered 1-92.

Early proof with many corrections in the hand of FTM. 1908. 122p., numbered 1-128. Missing p. 16, 46, 58, 88, 113, 114; p. 79-82 inserted after p. 96. From p. 69-128, the pages are numbered in blue pencil by FTM 1-58.

Proof, apparently a later version than IV.8.4. With corrections in the hand of FTM. 1908. 132 p., numbered 1-135, missing pages 16, 35, 48, 60, 82, 88. Pages seem to correspond to IV.8.4. but are numbered 2 higher

Proof, apparently an earlier version than IV.8.5, although there are different and occasionally the same corrections in FTM's hand in both versions. The chapter headings do not correspond to IV.8.5. This is possibly an earlier proof than IV.8.4. 124 p., numbered 2-128, missing p. 16, 34, 46, 88. Pages do not correspond consistently to those of other proofs. The verso of the last page contains autograph manuscript notes in the hand of FTM
Autograph manuscript essay on various types of dynamism. 28 p., unnumbered
I Diritti artistici, propugnati dai futuristi italiani. Manifesto al governo fascista

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed manifesto, with a note in upper left corner from FTM to an unidentified "Carissimo" asking for his opinion. Notes in pencil, in an unidentified hand on pp. 1-4 (in red pencil on p. 3). 4 p.

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript notes for an essay or book. 2 p.
Proof of the Italian edition of the poem. With corrections in FTM's hand 217 p., numbered (8)-223, p. 49-223 numbered by hand
Autograph manuscript essay with corrections. Title on verso of last page. 4 p.

Autograph manuscript notes, with different headings, all relating to this dictionary. p. 1 and 2 have heading: "Per un dizionario di locuzioni aviatorie", and include an introductory paragraph in FTM's hand with a newspaper article by Mecozzi Amedo pasted on the paper
The second group of 5 pages is headed "Piccolo dizionario di espressione aviatorie" and contains a list of words
The third item in this group is the newspaper arti- cle for which the previous pages were the manu- script. This is pasted on a piece of paper, with annotations on either side in FTM's hand

Autograph manuscript of a short play. On p. 1, the headings "A Destra" on the left side of the page, and "A Sinistra", on the right. These columns are divided by a red line and continued throughout. The "A Destra" column stops on p. 8. 10 p., numbered 1-10.
Autograph manuscript, with corrections. The last 3 pages are entitled "La Chanson du pauvre haleur", labelled in FTM's hand at top of p. 26. 29 p.

An untitled manuscript play in the hand of BCM, with corrections also in her hand Published, with some changes, in Teatro Filippo Tommaso Marinetti (ed. by Giovanni Calendoli, Rome, c. 1960, 3 vol.) as "Dramma senza titolo" (vol. 1, p. 1-88).

That version is noted as "Traduzione di Benedetta Marinetti dall'inedito francese" (vol. 1, p. 1), and "...si pubblica per la prima volta nella trascri- zione che è stata curata da Benedetta Marinetti" (v. 1 p. 281). This incomplete play was never performed. 109 p.

Typescript (carbon copy) of FTM's manuscript in French. Title-page, corrections of typographical errors, and the author's name at the beginning and end written in blue ink in the hand of BCM Part of Act I is missing. 64 p., numbered 1-70 plus title-page. Missing p. 6-12.
Autograph manuscript poem, two versions, incomplete 3 p., numbered in upper right corners 9 and 14.
Autograph manuscript notes for an essay, with many corrections. 3 p., unnumbered
Autograph manuscript notes. Title written in blue pencil on verso. 1 p.

Autograph manuscript additions to the printed text With corrections in ink and blue pencil in FTM's hand. Character's name changed from Wilson to Marinetti (see list of characters). 48 p., numbered 1-32 by hand from Scene II; previous page either unnumbered or not consecutively numbered.
Autograph manuscript draft of the play, apparently a later version of IV.9.14. Signed on title page In French. 84 p., numbered 1-82, plus title page and list of characters. 30 cm
Autograph manuscript with corrections. In French The same text as IV.9.15. 90 p., numbered 1-88, plus title-page and list of characters. 30 cm

Autograph manuscript play, in French, with corrections. Main characters' names are different from other versions: here Richard Franck and Mme Marie Franck; in IV.9.14-16, Richard Marinetti and Mme Marie Marinetti. 40 p., numbered 1-39, plus title-page. 31 cm

Autograph manuscript play, with corrections, signed on title-page. Main characters' names: Riccardo and Maria Marchi. 161 p., numbered as follows: Act I [1]-"25-30", 30-38, 38-86, 84-88; Act II, 89-108 (these pages are printed and pasted on); Act III, 109-151, 182-186; plus 4 p. of covers and title- page [related to: Electricité , Poupées électriques and La donna è mobile ]
Autograph manuscript fragment of the play. With corrections. 4 p., numbered 26-29.

Autograph manuscript notes. A section in the middle, numbered separately, 62, 68-72, is entitled on verso of the last page: "La veille du depart...". Heavily corrected with blue pencil. 58 p., mostly unnumbered
Autograph manuscript essay with many corrections Originally enclosed with IV.7.1.
Autograph manuscript poem signed on last page. 7 p., numbered in upper right corner.

Autograph manuscript. Title on verso of last page Written mostly in orange pencil with corrections in ink. Inserted between p. 4 and 5, a four-page essay, in ink, entitled "Le Concert" 30 p., numbered [1]-24, missing p. 3 and 15; additional unnumbered pages interspersed throughout
Eroi Macchine Ali contro nature morte di Renato di Bosso e A. G. Ambrosi
Typescript and holograph of an essay, signed on last page, with many manuscript corrections and additions. 3 p.
Typescript essay or lecture with a few additions in FTM's hand. 3 p.

An untitled autograph manuscript essay, apparently a review of two plays presented in Milan at the Theater Giolitti. With corrections, in French, beginning "Decidement la ville de Milan..." On verso of last page, in blue pencil: "6 Parco". 8 p., numbered [1]-8.
Typescript of the manifesto, with many corrections and additions in hand of FTM and possibly another. Signed on last page by FTM and Francesco Cangiullo. 4 p., numbered [1]-3.

p.ref: See also: Series V, Box 47, folder 1831

did.unittitle: Printed version (as "Manifesto Futurista dell'Amicizia di Guerra di Marinetti e Cangiullo"), Autori e Scrittori
Autograph manuscript poem, signed on last page. 3 p., numbered in upper right corner
Autograph manuscript notes and impressions of Europe, especially Strasbourg and Paris, with commentary on states of mind. 79 p., numbered 7-56 [missing pp. 15, 43]
Autograph manuscript notes, addresses and poetry relating to Europe, especially Poland, Belgrade and Bucharest. Accompanied by an explanation by LMB 63 p.
Autograph manuscript essay. Title written on verso of last page. 6 p.
Various notes about the history of facism, and futurism and fascism. In groups:
A. Autograph manuscript essay in the hands of Pino Masnata and an unidentified person. Begins: "A Milano-Sede del movimento futurista..." c. 1919. 12 p., numbered 1-[12]
B. Autograph manuscript in the hand of Pino Masnata about the history of fascism. 1919. 3 p., unnumbered

C. Autograph manuscript essay in the hands of FTM and another, entitled: "Firenze, Agosto 1918 - Fascio politico futurista - nuova Italia". Heading on p. 3 "Ottobre 1919" and on p. 4: "Milano - Giugno 1920". 4 p., unnumbered,
D. Autograph manuscript notes in the hands of FTM and Pino Masnata. At the top of p. 1: "Sampier-darena Agosto 1922". 5 p., unnumbered
E. Typescript notes, untitled (on Reale Accademia d'Italia stationery, thus after March, 1929). Begins: "Fragilissimi coralli delli dita di Berta..." 4 p., unnumbered
F. Typescript essay, untitled (also after March 1929), beginning: "Netti rivelatrici quelle del 1919..." Newspaper clipping pasted to page 4. 4 p., numbered [1]-[4]
G. Printed essay (possibly a proof for an article) by FTM about Ivanoe Fossani and the March on Rome. With corrections. 3 p., unnumbered
H. Typed essay (after March 1929) by FTM beginning: "Sensibilità di un anarchico alla vigilia..." 8 p., numbered [1]-8, Newspaper clipping pasted to p. [1]
I. Typed essay (after March 1929) by FTM beginning: "Un grande piedistallo..." With corrections in FTM's hand. 2 p., numbered [1]-2
J. Autograph manuscript notes (after March 1929?) on Reale Accademia stationery with date on verso "20-30 Novembre 1924 Primo Congresso Futurista" 2 p.
K. Autograph manuscript notes in FTM's hand beginning: "5 Aprile ore pomeriggio..." 1 p.
L. Typescript list or poem (after March 1929) by FTM beginning: "Cannoni in trincea al Ponte di Sussak". 1 p.
M. Typescript essay beginning: "Pigiatura di studenti acclamanti le aeropoesie futuriste nel caffè..." (after March 1929) 2 p.
N. Typescript essay with corrections in the hand of FTM beginning: "Una stramba e preoccupante ansia patriottica rivoluzionaria..." 3 p.
O. Autograph manuscript poem in an unidentified hand, dictated and corrected by FTM. Begins: "Tattilismi e palpeggi saporiti - profumati di battaglie rivoluzionarie..." 11 p., numbered on both sides
P. Autograph manuscript poem? In an unidentified hand. Dictated and corrected. 4 p., numbered in upper right corner
Q. Typescript poem beginning: "Fascino dell' assassinio patriottico..." 1 p.
"Fascitizziamo la critica spesso imprecisa ed esterofila mediante misurazioni italiane precise"
Autograph manuscript chapter for a book? Labelled "IIe", and followed by another chapter entitled "III Le problème de l'orgueil" labelled on verso of last page. 24 p., numbered 1-13, 2-9.
Autograph manuscript notes, 84 p., not consecutively numbered (including a 12 page letter to FTM from an unidentified author with diagrams dated 1904 Sep 15
Typescript, "da pubbicare" (written in FTM's hand on title-page). By FTM and Alberto Viviani 163 p., numbered 1-158, plus title-page and 4 p. note from editor

p.ref: See also: Series V, Box 48, folder 1935

did.unittitle: Typescript with a few corrections. Last 3 pages consist of an index of chapter headings, 61 in all 182 p., numbered 159-[341]
Autograph manuscript, with corrections, in the hand of FTM, and possibly one other. 224 p., numbered a-m, 1-204.
Autograph manuscript, with corrections, in the hand of FTM, and possibly one other. 238 p., numbered at top 205-437 bis
Typescript poem?, with corrections in the hand of FTM. 17 p., numbered 1-17.
La Fondation du Futurisme et son manifeste

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Proof. 3 p., numbered 1-2.

relatedmaterial.p: See also: Box 27, folder 1389 and Box 25, folders 1328-1333

did.unittitle: Foreword to collection of verses by Virgilio La Scola
Foreword to Deux Testaments by unidentified author
Autograph manuscript notes, philosophical reflections. 33 p. of varying sizes

Three carbon typescripts, with corrections in hand of FTM on all copies. One copy, "a", has 11 pages and appears complete. 31 p., numbered 1-11, 1-10, 1-10. Related to: Novelle colle labbra tinte , 1930.

Autograph manuscript, consisting of 17 short sections, marked a-i, l-s. The title appears on verso of last page, along with a list of names, crossed out. 18 p., numbered 1-18. (Later published, with variations and two introductory paragraphs, and signed by FTM and Tato, 11 Apr 1930)
Franco Casavola e la nuova musica
Autograph manuscript essay, with corrections. 21 p., numbered 1-[22], no page 13.
Autograph manuscript untitled essay, signed on last page, with corrections. 5 p., numbered 1-6, missing p. 2.
F. T. Marinetti ed i Futuristi alla Corda Fratres
Newspaper clipping pasted to a sheet of paper, with comments and corrections in the hand of FTM. 1 p.
La Funzione del teatro nella Roma fascista imperiale
Typescript speech with many corrections in the hand of FTM, signed on last page 6 p.
Autograph manuscript notes, with corrections. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript notes, with many corrections "Fort." written on first 3 pages. 5 p., unnumbered
Typescript of a speech made at the Sorbonne, 10 May 1924. With a few corrections in the hand of FTM. 29 p., numbered [1]-29.
Autograph manuscript essay, with corrections Incomplete: section 3, p. 38-58 missing. Six sections remain (139 p., numbered 1-37, 59-160):

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 7. Essence de la peinture futuriste. Page 134 includes 3 short paragraphs cut from a printed manifesto and pasted to the paper, 111-160

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript from a conference held in Bologna 18 Oct 1929, with extensive corrections in the hand of FTM. In pink pencil on top of p. 1: "12-12-22 Bodon". 61 p., numbered 1-60.

did.unittitle: Typescript essay, with many corrections in the hand of FTM. Verso of p. 10, and following four pages written by hand. 15 p., numbered 1-10, p. 1-7 written on scrap paper with crossed out AM notes on verso. Varying sizes, 16, 17, 19, 22 and 29 cm
Giovanni Verga celebrato dal Poeta Marinetti...

Two typescript versions of an article about the writer Giovanni Verga, one with extensive cor- rections in the hand of FTM, the other with the corrections incorporated into the text and with a few additional corrections in FTM's hand. 10 p., each copy 5 p.
Autograph manuscript essay signed on last page, with a few corrections. 15 p., numbered I-XIV
Typescript, with some notations in FTM's hand. 7 p.
Autograph manuscript essay, with corrections 11 p., numbered 1/a, 2/b, c-g
Il grande aeropoema della marina italiana
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections. 5 p.
La grande Milano Tradizionale e Futurista

Typescript, except for autograph manuscript table of contents (1 p.) which relates possibly to the manuscript version. This has additions in the hand of BCM relating to the typed copy. The typed table of contents (1 p.) includes the page numbers of both the typescript and the manuscript, and also includes a list of FTM's published works, 1904-09, in the hand of FTM

The typescript of the work itself has corrections in FTM's hand. The typescript is missing most of chapter 1, all of chapters 2-4, and part of chapter 6. In a light green folder, labeled (in the hand of BCM?) with the author's name, the title and 19"44". 181 p., numbered erratically 1-3, 128-302.
I grandi Alberi dell'Isola e la loro inventata leggenda vegetale
Autograph manuscript essay, with extensive corrections. 6 p., unnumbered
Autograph manuscript poem. Last page consists of notes. 3 p., unnumbered
Autograph manuscript essay, with corrections. 32 p.

Autograph manuscript fragment, with corrections, of the French translation. The first sentence, "Notre train court sur Trieste, la rouge poudrière d'Italie", corresponds to the section entitled "Battaglie di Trieste" of the Italian version (Milan, Edizioni futuriste di "Poesia", 1915).

This translation does not include the text of FTM's speech: "Discorso ai Triestini" (in the Italian version), but does include the description of the events (here entitled "Discorso", p. 6-19). The final paragraph of this translation is not present in the Italian version. 19 p.
Halte d'auto blindée dans le pré de la victoire
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections. 4 p.
Hymne à Giuseppe Garibaldi, Aux Armes! Aux Armes!
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, signed on last page. Additional markings in orange and blue pencil. Title on verso of last page. 5 p., numbered 7, 8, 32, 43, 44.
Autograph manuscript, heavily corrected. With title on verso of last page crossed out. Was originally grouped with Venise IV.34.1-3 and [Mimy?] IV.17.24. 6 p.
Autograph manuscript, with many corrections. A different title (Aeropoem su Roma [a Benedetta]) crossed out on verso of last page. 11 p., numbered 80-90

Autograph manuscript poem? with many corrections, divided into two sections, Gli idrovolanti and Lotta dei siluri e dei delfini contro gli idro- volanti. 19 p., numbered 19-[23], and 1-14, Page [23] consists of 2 separate pages, one numbered 25 or 28, pasted to a separate sheet
Autograph manuscript essay, with corrections. 12 p.
Typescript of corrections for English edition, with additions in an unidentified hand, possibly that of FTM. 3 p.
Autograph manuscript poem, a fragment from Gli Indomabili. At top of page: "Dalla canzone degli Indomabili di F. T. Marinetti". 1 p.
Autograph manuscript article, dated on cover 1919, Nov 4, for the journal "Arditi". Signed on the last page. 10 p., numbered 1-5.
Autograph manuscript, with corrections, signed on bottom of the last page. In French. 3 p.
"Italiani liberatevi dalle abitudini inglesi: manifesto futurista"
Autograph manuscript in an unidentified hand with corrections by FTM. 200 p., brittle around edges, numbered 1-200.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript notes. 22 p.

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript notes about travels. 8 p.

Autograph manuscript notes with corrections and a blue pen line that crosses the page from upper left to lower right. Last three pages seem to be FTM's notes written on letters from Guido Keller to FTM. 10 p.

p.ref: See also: Series III, Box 12, folder 616

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript dramatic poem, divided into three sections: Les Rochers, Le triomphant Amour, and La Femme. With many corrections. 10 p.

Autograph manuscript notes, with corrections, accompanied by a 6-page extract from a book headed "Les événements d'Italie" and a 2-page newspaper clipping from Genova, "Caffaro", dated 1900, Aug 29-30. The newspaper clipping is headed: "Il pro- cesso del regicida Bresci alle Assise di Milano."
18 p., AM: unnumbered; book extract, numbered 313-318; newspaper clipping
Typescript describing the "vertenza" between Umberto Notari and Alberto Cianca; FTM represented the former. Dated 1923, May 27. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript article, with a few corrections, and an addition of an extract from a periodical dated 12-1-24. 16 p. Periodical clipping pasted onto p. 13.
Autograph manuscript letter, signed, accompanied by four pages of notes and two pages of drawings 7 p.
Typescript essay about the poetry of the Berchet brothers. 23 Mar 1937. 2 p.
Manuscript, possibly in the hand of FTM, with many corrections. The six "sintesi" are as follows (149 p., including cover title Numbered inconsistently):

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript play. Although the title-page is labeled "7 sintesi" there are only six. The title-page was changed from 6 to 7. Corrections and additions in the hand of TTM. All titles of "sintesi" the same as IV.15.8. except for number 6 which here bears the title "Treni in libertà." 128 p., numbered [1]-118.
Autograph manuscript play with corrections. Pub- lished in Il teatro futurista (Naples, Editrice CLET, 1941). 5 p., p. 1-4, 31 cm. p. 5
Excerpt, printed version, Gazzetta del Popolo
Autograph manuscript essay, with corrections. 5 p., numbered 1-6. Missing p. 3 although text seems to follow logically from p. 2 to 4.
Typescript, carbon copy. 9 p. [Related to: Novelle colle labra tinte , 1930.]
La lune ivre et les lagunes
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections and notes. Before 1900. 7 p.
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections. 5 p.
Autograph manuscript poem. Title at top of page 1; on verso of the last page: "Piccola macchina lirica". 9 p.
Autograph manuscript notes about machines, with many corrections. Sections crossed out in blue pencil. 2 p., numbered [1]-2.
Autograph manuscript notes about machines, with corrections and diagrams. 4 p., numbered 1-4.
Autograph manuscript poem signed in pencil on bottom of last page. With corrections. 2 p., numbered 1-2. In red pencil at top of pages, numbered 260-261.

Manuscript poem in an unidentified hand. 3 p., numbered 1-3.

Autograph manuscript collection of poems, grouped under title "Mlle Clair de Lune". Other poems included in this group are: "Le poison des crepu- scules/Le poison des étoiles" (possibly an outline for a play), and Er Cane e la Cayna, possibly in the hand of Trilussa. Probably 1900-09. 7 p., unnumbered

did.unittitle: Typescript essay about Maeterlinck, in Italian, with corrections, in FTM's hand. 4 p., numbered 1-4.
Autograph manuscript essay addressed to Maeterlinck, with corrections, in French. 2 p.

Autograph manuscript notes for the play, with extensive corrections. Including notes for other works. Title at top of page 1. On p. 71 at top: "Le soleil enchainé, roman africain"; on p. 102 top: "Notes sur 'Salammbô'". In no order. 223 p., num- bered variously, paper of varying sizes

Autograph manuscript notes, possibly for Mafarka Heading on p. 59: "Chevelure d'or"; on p. 102: "Le soleil enchainé"; on p. 127 "Poeme futuriste sur la grande bataille que les forces volcaniques livreront contre Venise"; on p. 140: "Fragments de Gazourmah-roi". 182 p., numbered variously, paper of varying sizes
Autograph manuscript notes for Mafarka. Heavily corrected, with drawings. 82 p. of varying sizes, some numbered
Autograph manuscript poem signed at bottom of last page. Published in Poesie à Beny pp. 55-7. 8 p.

Autograph manuscript essay, with a few corrections, signed at bottom of last page. Several pages have sections from a printed essay cut out, pasted, and integrated into this essay. The excerpts constitute most of the first four paragraphs of the manifesto La splendeur geometrique et mecanique et la sensi- bilite numerique (1914 Mar 11). Possibly written in 1921 as first sentence reads: "Nous autres futu- ristes, nous avons commencé, il y a douze ans..." 8 p., numbered 1-8; p. 4

Autograph manuscript draft of the first futurist manifesto, with corrections in pen, pencil and blue crayon. Drawing on page 12. At top of page 1: "La fondation du futurisme et son manifeste". 31 p., numbered 1-[16], 1-17.

dao.xlink:title: Autograph manuscript draft of the first futurist manifesto, with corrections in pen, pencil and blue crayon. Drawing on page 12. At top of page 1: "La fondation du futurisme et son manifeste". 31 p., numbered 1-[16], 1-17.

daodesc.p: Autograph manuscript draft of the first futurist manifesto, with corrections in pen, pencil and blue crayon. Drawing on page 12. At top of page 1: "La fondation du futurisme et son manifeste". 31 p., numbered 1-[16], 1-17.

Typescript with corrections, possibly in the hand of FTM. Three names at bottom of last page: Filippo Tommaso Marinetti, Luigi Scrivo, and Piero Bellanova. 4 p.

Autograph manuscript, perhaps intended for a speech, with corrections. Several pages cut and pasted together (p. 1-4, 18). The text consists of nine paragraphs from the Manifesto dei pittori futuristi (1910 Feb 11) followed by nine paragraphs from La pittura futurista, manifesto tecnico (1910 Apr 11), by Boccioni, Carra, Russolo, Balla and Severini. On cover and occasionally throughout the manuscript "Russolo" or "R" written in an uniden- tified hand in purple pencil. 27 p., including cover title, numbered 1-25.

Autograph manuscript notes for the manifesto and other miscellaneous notes about the avant-garde, Dada, surrealism, Freud, and the meaning of the Futurist movement. 34 p., pages numbered variously Of differing sizes

Small card with scales drawn on it in ink and pen- cil. "Violino" written at top, in hand of FTM? 1 p.
Autograph manuscript outline including names of poets important to futurism. 5 p.

Autograph manuscript notes about Naples. In lower right corner of page 1: "La Zolfatara di Napoli" Page 1 is written on the verso of a TLS to FTM from the Ente Italiano per le Audizioni Radiofoniche signed Lefozzi, 3 May 1930. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript poem signed at bottom of last page. 10 p.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted material. May not be seen without the permission of the appropriate curator. Photocopy filed in box 28, folder 1422.

did.unittitle: Photocopy of: Autograph manuscript poem signed at bottom of last page. 10 p.
Navigation tactile (Poésie tactile mots en liberté).
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections. Signed on bottom of last page. An earlier version of IV.18.3. 5 p., numbered [1]-5 and also 252-256 in red pencil at top of each page
Autograph manuscript poem, apparently in the hand of FTM, signed at bottom of last page. Italian version of IV.18.3-5. 6 p.
Autograph manuscript essay on Nietzsche. In French 8 p.

Autograph manuscript essay, with corrections, signed by FTM on last page. The first paragraph explains that this is an Italian translation of an article by FTM that appeared in the Parisian newspaper Gil Blas concerning the Notari trial. 22 p.
Typescript essay, with corrections in FTM's hand, about Umberto Notari 5 p.
La nouvelle poesie de la machine futuriste...
Autograph manuscript outline for an essay, with corrections. 4 p.
La nouvelle religion morale de la vitesse

Autograph manuscript notes with corrections. On cover title: "Notes et traduction française du manifeste du Religion morale de la Vitesse" and "Ebauches de poèmes français." 49 p., varying sizes, including cover title
La Nouvelle religion morale de la vitesse, manifeste
Autograph manuscript with a few corrections, possibly in the hand of FTM, at bottom of last page signed "M. traduit très mal" 17 p.

Autograph manuscript draft of a novel, heavily corrected, with portions of pages pasted on other pages. Some of the headings at the top of the page refer to "Orgo". In Italian. 40 p., numbered incon- sistently
Autograph manuscript, with corrections. 6 p., 4 p. with 2 p. cover title
Autograph manuscript translation of FTM's manifesto "La nouvelle religion morale de la vitesse", with a few corrections. 20 p., numbered [1]-20.
Autograph manuscript, with a few corrections Continued in IV.19.2. Signed on title-page. 150 p., including cover title. Numbered [1]-149.
Autograph manuscript, with a few corrections. Second part of IV.l9.1. 256 p., numbered 150-391.
Typescript carbon, with corrections, additions, and editorial instructions by FTM 223 p., including title-page, numbered [1]-218. Bound in construction paper with tacks
Typescript carbon, more extensively corrected than IV.19.3. 224 p., including title-page, numbered [1]-218. Bound in construction paper with tacks
"Nuove battaglie per l'italianità di tulla l'arte moderna"
Autograph manuscript poem, with many corrections Title on verso of last page. 4 p., numbered 1-4.
Autograph manuscript poem, with many corrections 9 p.
Autograph manuscript notes about Eugene O'Neill, identified as "O Neal futurista americano..." Also includes outline for essay on simultaneity of time and space. 8 p.
Originalità Russa di Masse Distanze Radiocuori

Carbon copy of a typescript, with no corrections Accompanied by a small piece of paper, in FTM's hand?, with a correspondence between manuscript and typescript pages. This numberical correspondence is separated each time by one word followed by a question mark. 119 p., numbered 1-118 (2 pages 83s)
A second carbon copy, with no corrections, except for one page which is original typed sheet. 119 p., numbered 1-118, (including two page 83s).

Original typescript, with corrections in FTM's hand, and inserted into the middle of the typescript is a manuscript page in an unidentified hand labeled at the top: "Parole russe da controllare". 120 p., numbered 1-118 (including two of page 83) and an inserted ms. page after p. 70, that lists correspondences of Russian and Italian words

Autograph manuscript essay written on the verso of a letter to FTM from the Regia Universita Italiana per Stranieri of Perugia, dated 29 May 1929. Enclosed in an envelope with a different title and, at the bottom, "Marinetti e Azari". 2 p.
"Il Paesaggio nei sentimenti e nelle poesie di Napoli"

Carbon typescript, with extended title at top of page 1: "Le eleganze della palma italia, ricca dei suoi datteri paradisiaci. Aeropoema futurista con parole in libertà olfattive Tattili da rappresentare teatralmente in una Oasi". 122 p., including title- page, numbered [1]-122 (p. 104-5 on one page).
Carbon typescript, same as IV.21.1. 122 p., inclu- ding title-page, numbered [1]-122. In green manila folder, with title written on cover (in hand of BCM).
Carbon typescript, same as IV.21.1. 122 p., inclu- ding title-page, numbered [1]-122. In green manila folder, with title and FTM's name written on cover by BCM
Autograph manuscript note about Pan Club, Budapest and Buenos Aires. On top of page: "Risposta". 1 p.

relatedmaterial.p: See: Box 31, folder 1470 and Box 23, folders 1283-84

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections. 1 p.
Autograph manuscript notes beginning: "Parole in libertà." 1 p.

relatedmaterial.p: See also: Box 36, folder 1631 and Box 37, folder 1643

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript notes, with many corrections and a diagram, relating to Passo Uarieu. 2 p.

Typescript with corrections in the hand of FTM. The title-page is labelled: "Alla Ricerca di una nuova morale, Romanzo d'avventure legislative", and above it in the hand of FTM: "Bozze e scorie(?) di patriottismo insetticida." 141 p., including title-page. Numbered 1-140. Index on p. 140.
Carbon typescript of IV.21.7, with corrections in FTM's hand. Missing chapter 7 ("Il poema dei Languori del Golfo di Napoli", p. 74-81). 133 p., missing 74-81.
Autograph manuscript notes on Patriottismo insetticida and other issues. 22 p., varying sizes
Autograph manuscript notes with heading at the top; "Alla ricerca di una nuova morale". 1 p.
Typescript fragments, both original and carbon 26 p.
Proof with extensive corrections by FTM. At the end, eight manuscript pages, possibly in the hand of FTM 174 p., numbered inconsistently
Uncorrected proof, still retaining the earlier title of "Alla Ricerca di una nuova morale". 160 p., num- bered [1]-[197]
Proof with correct title, no corrections in the text. 161 p., numbered [1]-[194]
Paysage d'odeurs de mon chien-loup, (poésie olfactive mots en liberté).
Autograph manuscript (fragment of a larger work) with a few corrections, signed on the last page 7 p., numbered [1]-7 in pen and 268-274 in red pencil
Autograph manuscript poem, with title written twice on the verso of the last page. 21 p., numbered 1-21.
Pensées de nuit tombante (prière à la tristesse).
Autograph manuscript essay with corrections, signed at the end of page 3 and dated 27 May 1898. Title on last page: "Prière à la tristesse." 5 p.
Autograph manuscript poem with title at top of page 1, in pencil. 5 p., numbered [1]-5.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted material. May not be seen without the permission of the appropriate curator. Photocopy filed in box 31, folder 1464.

did.unittitle: Photocopy of: Autograph manuscript poem with title at top of page 1, in pencil. 5 p., numbered [1]-5.
Piccolo ritratto futurista di Anna Fougez

Autograph manuscript, with title on verso of last page followed by: "mots en liberté de Marinetti e Cangiullo, Abstraction dramatique de Balla, Brui- teurs de Russolo." Text in Italian. 8 p., numbered [1]-7.
Autograph manuscript outline for an essay on Pirandello. In Italian. 8 p., numbered a-h
Autograph manuscript notes and outline for a play 4 p.
Autograph manuscript notes for two plays, "Gli sfocati" (commedia), and "Le mani". 2 p.

Autograph manuscript play lacking a title-page. In a turquoise folder labeled with FTM's name and the title "Paolo Baglione" in the hand of either FTM or BCM. In French. "Paolo Baglione" was later produced as "Dramma senza titolo." 191 p., numbered 1-68; 1-54; 1-12; 14-26; 1-44
Autograph manuscript notes for a poem. On verso of page 2: "Bois en silence. Bois!" 2 p.
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, begin- ning: "Comme il partait pour un voyage..." 5 p.
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, begin- ning "Dopo avere poppato 6 ore..." 4 p., numbered [1]-4.

Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, begin- ning: "Grazie...per i...". A note written to FTM in another hand on verso of p. 34 in blue pencil. 59 p., numbered 1-65, missing p. 26, 30, 43, 60-62.
Autograph manuscript poem, incomplete, with corrections, beginning: "Immenses filets..." 1 p.
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, signed at the end. Poem begins: "J'ai fait ce rêve..." 2 p.
Autograph manuscript poem signed and dated at bottom of sheet, Milan, 5 Decembre 1896. Begins: "Je veux pour toi l'amour..." 1 p.

Autograph manuscript notes for various poems, in- cluding La Lutte and a list of other poems on page 1. Also in this group is a draft of "Un Soir... de Paroles" (Le Demon de la Vitesse) and "A toute Vitesse (Les trains)". 15 p.
Autograph manuscript poem with corrections, begin- ning: "Mon bel ange sensuel, brûlant et trempé..." 3 p., numbered [1]-3.
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, begin- ning: "Nous étions étrangers..." Signed and dated after last line 1 Settembre 1896. With additional notes in pencil at the bottom of page 2. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript poem with drawings, beginning: "tutto tutto tutto tutto per la patria..." 5 p.
Autograph manuscript poem with corrections begin- ning: "Un soir qu'il ferait noir..." 2 p.
Autograph manuscript poem, [1943], beginning "volto, volto, volto..." 1 p.
Autograph manuscript fragment of a poem beginning on p. 3: "Ne lance pas trop loin ton coeur..." 5 p.
Autograph manuscript notes for a poem beginning "Buc, bianco..." 16 p., pages of varying sizes
Autograph manuscript notes, possibly for various poems, in French. On verso of last page: "Le papere sono rivelazioni del subcosciente direbbe Freud." 19 p.
Autograph manuscript notes for poems about Africa, Marakesh. In Italian. 5 p.
Autograph manuscript notes for a poem beginning "Quando la spiaggia..." 1 p.
Autograph manuscript notes for various poems (?) beginning: "Roman..." 11 p.

Autograph manuscript poems from 1896 and a few from 1897, mostly in French. In addition to poems, many notes for poetry and other things such as a five- page vocabulary list and two pages of notes on Schopenhauer, Whitman, Wyzewa and others and four pages of notes on Maurice Barrès. 188 p. Among the identified poems are:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notte lunare, 2 p. Baisers, 4 p. with notes Erotica, 2 p. with notes La jeunesse est radieuse, 1 p., 1897 Jan 26 Un rêve, 2 p. Rêves, impressions, silhouettes, 4 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rupture, 1 p. 1896 Jan[?] 2 Rupture d'amour, 5 p. with notes Le réveil du Dieu Soleil, 1 p. 1896 Jul 25 A Mademoiselle M..., 1 p. with notes Adieu, crépusculaire, 7 p. Crepuscolo marino, 2 p. Fatalité d'amour, 2 p. Crepuscolo, 2 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Couchant d'automne, 1 p. Macabres luxures, 1 p. 1896 Jul 29 [?] Amours funèbres, 4 p. 1896 Aug 22 Les nuages, 14 p. 1896 Aug 12 Vos sourires, 1 p. with 7 pp. of drafts of letters in the hand of FTM to unidentified recipient Le tremplin de mes rêves, 8 p. with 3 pp. noted for a poem "Le Parfum de ta Peau" Chateaubriand, 1 p. Paysages abolis, 4 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conseils du soir, 1 p. 1896 Dec 16 Diptyque de la lune, 2 p. Légende andalouse, 6 p. with notes La filandière, 3 p. with notes Pour la porte des Courtisanes [and] Pour la porte des Prêtresses, 2 p. Sonnet à ma plume, 1 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vers l'ideal, 1 p. Aube, 2 p. Ballade, 1 p. l'échanson des nuits, 4 p. 1897 Jan 16 Amour!, 1 p. 1896 Jun 14[?] Le Soir et la Ville, 2 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Le douce prison, 5 p. with notes "J'éprouve a t'aimer...", 2 p. "Odeur des bêtes féroces...", 2 p. II. Sonnet, 1 p. La Maisonnette, 2 p. 1896 Dec 3 Vers le soir, 2 p. Couchant, 1 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Aux premières heures du monde...", 3 p., numbered 2-4 "Car le soir est venu...", 4 p. L'amour boudeur[?] (beginning: "Nous etions étrangers l'un a l'autre..."), 8 p. 1896 Sep 1 Votre jeu[?], 1 p. "Dédicace A Mademoiselle Louise Galtinoire[?]", 1 p. Au delà de la mort, 1 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "IIeme Partie de la 'Une suggestion Criminelle'", 2 p. Cher Calamus, 1 p. "Vous êtes...", 1 p. "Couchant en fusion...", 4 p. with "Le jeune prince..." on verso of last page "Et je te vois debut...", 1 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 12 fragments of poems

p.ref: See: Box 24, folder 1308, group O and group P

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript notes for the Poema africano, with many corrections. 30 p., unnumbered, varying sizes

Typescript with a few corrections in the hand of FTM, followed by seven pages of the proof, heavily corrected, and a 1-page carbon sheet with notes in FTM's hand on the verso. The cover title and title-pages bear FTM's name and the title of the work and instructions to the publisher, all in FTM's hand. 233 p., numbered 1-221 (p. 54 placed between p. 113 & 114 and there is a p. 196 bis).
Carbon typescript of IV.23.12, with same corrections

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 225 p., numbered 1-221, incl. title-page in FTM's hand

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript draft with chapters in various hands with corrections by FTM. 150 p., numbered inconsistently 1-192.
Carbon typescript with corrections in the hand of FTM? 68 p. numbered 9-79; missing pp. 14-15
Carbon typescript with corrections in the hand of FTM. 138 p., numbered 80-234. Last 26 p. in FTM's hand. Missing pp 112-113. also various newspaper clippings inserted between pages

Two carbon typescript copies of chapters 1-15. Possibly an earlier version of IV.24.2-3 as here the title for chapter 1 reads "Geometria appassion- ata" and later became "Simultaneità di marcia geo- metrica appassionata" (Chapter 4). 86 p., copy 1 numbered 1-39; copy 2, 1-47.
Autograph manuscript with corrections, possibly a draft of a chapter. 26 p., first portion numbered a-h
Autograph manuscript of chapter 52, "Simultaneita delle acque del Tonqua". On verso of last page: "La Canzone del Tonqua". 8 p., numbered 169-176.
Typescript and autograph manuscript, possibly a chapter from the Poema africano, both with correct- ions in FTM's hand. 19 p., 3 typescript, 16 manuscript numbered 1-16.
Carbon typescript of various random parts of the poem. With corrections and notes in the hand of FTM. 32 p., numbered inconsistently
Proof with extensive corrections in the hand of FTM. 140 p., numbered 1-140.
Proof, same as IV.24.9., with extensive corrections, some of which differ from those in IV.24.9. 134 p., numbered 7-140.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript signed on last page. 22 p.

did.unittitle: Newsprint edition of the poem of this title on p. 48 of Il Romanzo Settimanale , no year. 2 p.
Il Poema del Vestito di Latte
Typescript and carbon with corrections in the hand of FTM. Both copies have same corrections, but only the first copy signed by FTM on last page. 7 p. each
Il Poema della battaglia di Via Mercanti [15 Apr 1919]

Typescript, with corrections in FTM's hand. Last seven pages are autograph manuscript, probably written in 1939. A work of this title was published in the Gazzetta del Popolo 1939 Apr 15. 21 p., numbered [1]-16, 3-7.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Box 38, folder 1674 and Box 36, folder 1620

did.unittitle: Typescript with corrections in FTM's hand, a later version of IV.25.6. 15 p., numbered [1]-15.
Poema della Litoranea Abbeveratoio di Velocità.
Typescript with corrections in the hand of FTM. 9 p., numbered [1]-9.
Poema della Litoranea Vestita di Ruote
Typescript with corrections in the hand of FTM. 11 p., numbered [1]-11.
Il poema di Cozzarini and Des Cozzarini Aerodichtung

Autograph manuscript notes for this poem, one page written on the verso of a letter to FTM from Gino Cucchetti, Director of l'Illustrazione Italiana, dated 1 Feb 1943. A German version of this poem is enclosed. Typescript 6 p. with corrections in ink (in FTM's hand?). The German version is entitled "Des Cozzarini Aerodichtung, Worte in futuristicher Freiheit". More of FTM's notes continue on the verso of the last page of this typescript. 19 p., 13 p. of manuscript and 6 p. typescript
Typescript with title and corrections in FTM's hand. 7 p., numbered 1-7.
Il poema di Torre Viscosa città cannevora, parole in libertà futuriste
Autograph manuscript poem in the hand of Pino Masnata. Notes on verso of the last page in the hand of FTM. 20 p., numbered [1]-20.
Il poema elbano delle riparazioni al motore (?).
Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, in the hand of FTM. 7 p., numbered 1-7.

Autograph manuscript poem, with notes on verso of the last page. Published in Filippo Tommaso Marinetti, Presenta i nuovi poeti futuristi (Rome: Edizioni Futuriste di "Poesia", 1925) pp. 293-94. 3 p., numbered [1]-3.
Autograph manuscript poem, same as IV.25.15. 3 p., numbered 1-3.
Autograph manuscript poem with notes by FTM on verso of the last page Text same as IV.25.15-16. 7 p., numbered 1-7.
Typescript with title in hand of FTM. A different text from IV.25.15-17. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript poem with corrections in the hand of FTM. 14 p., including cover title, numbered 1-13.

A combination of autograph manuscript pages, type- script, printed pages, proofs and newspaper clip- pings, consisting of several poems grouped under the title La Poesia dei Tecnicismi . Heavily cor- rected by FTM, with his signature often at the end of a poem, sometimes crossed out. 65 p., p. [1-12] numbered seperately, then the rest numbered 1-53.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: See also (for the original manuscripts and type- scripts of several of the poems): Box 33, folder 1503 Box 33, folder 1506 Box 33, folder 1509 Box 33, folder 1510

did.unittitle: "La Poesia Mobilitata a servizio della guerra"
La Poésie de Mallarmé d'après l'analyse de deux sonnets

Autograph manuscript notes for an essay on Mallarmé and also Rachilde and Maurice Barrès. Written on stationery from l'Anthologie Revue , thus dating these sheets c. 1897-1900. A third page contains a poem, with corrections, in the hand of FTM, but the handwriting dates from a later time. 5 p.
Carbon typescript with corrections in FTM's hand. 37 p., numbered [1]-37.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Box 28, folder 1390 and Box 28, folder 1394

did.unittitle: Poetare e tracannare nella osteria dei soldati repubblicani alla salute dell'Italia immortale

A group of typescript and carbon poems by "Gli Aeropoeti Marinetti, Acquaviva, Farfa, e le aeropoetesse Anna Viva, Maria Goretti, Dina Cucini, Desiderio Rosa. One of the poems dated 1 Mar 1944. Brief headings to each of the poems in the hand of FTM. 22 p., including title-page. Each poem numbered separately.

Autograph manuscript notes or outline for a confer- ence on futurist poets. The participants were: Benedetta (BCM), Buccafusca, Farfa, Masnata, Sanzin, Scurto, Taler, and Vasari Notes of other names on page 2. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript notes, with corrections, about government and democracy. In French. Probably ca. 1898. 6 p., numbered inconsistently p. [1-6]

Autograph manuscript miscellaneous notes, the first section beginning "Contro il parlamentarismo e il suffragio universale", but including notes for various manifestos, "Contro l'Austria" and "Contro i musei". Heavily corrected, in French and Italian 8 p.
Autograph manuscript notes, with corrections, mostly pertaining to socialism, in French. Possibly c. 1898. 21 p.
Autograph manuscript notes about Marx and Bernstein With corrections, in Italian. 2 p.
Two autograph manuscript versions of a poem, with corrections. The first version is two pages; the second is 16 p. and has the title crossed out. 19 p.
Autograph manuscript notes including a newspaper clipping about lightning hitting an explosives factory in Germany. 4 p.

Autograph manuscript novel with extensive cor- rections. The text ends in the middle of a sentence A work by this name was listed as "en preparation" on the verso of the half-title page of La conquête des étoiles (Paris, 1902). 50 p., numbered 1-42.

Autograph manuscript novel, a later draft of IV.26. 10, here entitled Les porteurs du feu . The manu- script corresponds very closely to the earlier ver- sion. This version is 15 lines longer than the ear- lier one. 95 p., numbered 1-95.
Portrait olfactif d'une femme, (poésie olfactive mots en liberté).
Autograph manuscript signed at bottom of last page 3 p., numbered [1]-3, and in red pencil, 257-259.
Autograph manuscript poem, same version as IV.26.12 but 5 words longer. 12 p., numbered 1-12.
Autograph manuscript poem, same version as IV.26.12 and 13, but 4 words longer than IV.26.12 and one word shorter than IV.26.13. 9 p.
Autograph manuscript preface to a book by Maffio Maffii entitled Cleopatra contro Roma. FTM grouped these prefaces under the heading "Collaudi". 9 p., numbered [1]-9.
Autograph manuscript preface to a book by Gian Franco Merli entitled Radioaviazione . 5 p., numbered [1]-5.
Typescript with corrections in FTM's hand of a preface to a book by Ruggere Micheloni entitled "Dimostrazione scientifica del Futurismo." 6 p.
Autograph manuscript play, with corrections. 65 p., numbered 1-65.

Mimeographed typescript with corrections and printing instructions in FTM's hand. The title is written in FTM's hand at the top of page [1] as "Les prisonniers de Baia, 8 synthèses futuristes enchainées", signed at the bottom of the last page 30 p., numbered [1]-30.
Mimeographed typescript bound in light blue construction paper on which the author's name and title are written in blue ink. Uncorrected version of IV.26.19. 30 p., numbered [1]-30.
Three copies of a mimeographed typescript of the play, uncorrected and corresponding to IV.26.20. 90 p., 30 p. each, not including blue cover. Each numbered [1]-30.
Les prisonniers à Baia, 8 synthèses enchainées
Mimeographed typescript with corrections and title written in FTM's hand. The text corresponds to IV.26.19-21, and the corrections correspond to IV.26.19. 30 p., numbered [1]-30.
Autograph manuscript draft of a play, with many corrections. 24 p.
Programma futurista di una giornata aerea
Autograph manuscript, with corrections, signed on last page. 26 p., numbered 1-25.
Programma futurista di una giornata aerea
Carbon typescript of IV.27.2 with no corrections, 5 p.
Typescript with corrections of a proposal from FTM to Mussolini for the establishment of " l'Istituto di credito per gli scrittori e artisti creatori". 3 p.

Autograph manuscript draft of a proposal to Mussolini from FTM for the establishment of an "Istituto credito per artisti e scrittori", probably an earlier version of IV.27.4. Extensive corrections. 8 p., numbered [1]-8.

Typescript with corrections in FTM's hand addressed to the heads of various newspapers entitled " Originalita letterarie, artistiche e ideologiche mondiali scelte da S.E. Marinetti". On p. 2, one paragraph written for "i giornali maggiori" and another for "i giornali minori". 2 p.
Autograph manuscript notes for futurist publicity 5 p.
Manuscript poem, in the hand of BCM with corrections by FTM. 15 p., numbered 1-15 in pen over which is numbered 48-62 in pencil
Manuscript "aeropoem" in hand of BCM. Signed on the last page. 11 p., numbered 1-11.
Typescript essay with no corrections. 5 p., numbered [1]-5.
Quarto d'ora di poesia della decima mas

Autograph manuscript poem here entitled "Musica di sentimenti decima mas", heavily corrected. Text written on the versos and recto of a letter and enclosure to FTM from Giotto Danielli, President of the Accademia d'Italia, dated 13 Nov 1944. 3 p.

Autograph manuscript draft of the poem, heavily corrected and here entitled, "Musica di sentimenti per la decima mas". Written on the versos and rectos of a two-page letter to FTM from Guiseppe Bottari, dated 25 Nov 1944. 4 p.

Autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, signed at the end, written on paper torn from a notebook Page [5] has printing directions in pencil in the left margin in a different hand. The poem is followed by a blank page and then 4 p. of notes by FTM. Known to be the last work of FTM, written in Como, Nov 1944. 20 p., 10 blank

Written by FTM and Pino Masnata. First 6 pages consist of a typescript glued to paper, with no corrections, of La Radio, Manifesto futurista dell'ottobre 1933 . The remainder of the work consists of 22 short chapters in the hand of Pino Masnata. (One section, "La Parole in Libertà", pp. 35-37, is a typescript with corrections in the hand of Masnata.) Many pages have been mounted on paper. Unsigned, although the cover bears both names as does the end of the typescript manifesto, page 6. 52 p. Includes cover title, numbered 1-51.
Printed version (as "Manifeste de la Radia Futuriste"), Comoedia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (accompanied by commentary article by Armando Zamboni)

did.unittitle: Manuscript notes in the hand of Pino Masnata and possibly of FTM. 4 p.
La Reciprocità nello scambio delle opere teatrali fra i diversi paesi
Typescript with corrections in the hand of FTM. 3 p., numbered [1]-3.
Autograph manuscript notes, with corrections, possibly an outline for a manifesto. Glued on the last page is a newspaper clipping of a quotation from Ibsen, in Italian. 6 p., numbered 1-6.
La religieuse et le marchand de pourceaux
Autograph manuscript poem, or dialogue, with corrections. 7 p., numbered [1]-7.
Remplaçons l'amour par une nouvelle volupté.
Autograph manuscript outline in four parts, mostly crossed out with a blue pencil. 3 p.

Autograph manuscript draft of a letter to Maurice Bedel justifying FTM's reasons for joining the Royal Academy of Italy. In response to a letter from Maurice Bedel published in Nouvelles Litteraires questioning FTM's action. Heavily corrected 27 p.
Report on "I Volontari Ciclisti del Battaglione Lombardo" and the Fall 1915 campaign against Austria [authorship uncertain]
Printed version, in unidentified newspaper (clipped and pasted to sheets of writing papers)
Response to inquiry on "l'expropriation forcée" in Poland
Response to inquiry on writers (FTM comments on Leopardi, Giosué and Hugo)
Le retour de ma bien-aimée (Elle est revenue).

Autograph manuscript notes on a variety of subjects, including 4 pages about Florence with a drawing on the last page, 3 pages of notes for La Conquête des Étoiles on the stationery of L'Anthologie Revue , and 9 pages of notes for other poems. "Le Retour..." written on verso of the last page. ca. 1898-1901. 17 p.
Autograph manuscript draft of a play, with many corrections. Title written on orange folder and at top of page [1] with the list of characters. 302 p., numbered 1-252.
Autograph manuscript notes for the play, accompanied by an explanation by LMB. 13 p., varying sizes
Manuscript letter, in the hand of BCM, with corrections by FTM. Italian version of the French. 25 p., numbered [1]-25.
"Riposta del poeta Marinetti agli scrittori Jules Romains, Duhamel, Pierard, Benjamin Cremieux, Ludwig, Wolf, Wells"
Autograph manuscript with title on verso of p. 2. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript with a few corrections, signed on last page. 10 p., numbered 1-10.
Ritratto poetico di Castoldi - Fiat - Agello

Autograph manuscript apparently in two parts. The first part begins: "Di colpo lontano dal terrestre tic-tac femminile Agello Castoldi...", 8 p.; the second begins "Trenta campi d'oro viola simmetrici...", 19 p. 27 p., numbered 1-8, 1-19.
Proof of the play with extensive corrections and additions in FTM's hand Title written in blue pencil at top of page 1. 207 p., numbered [1]-[201]

Autograph manuscript notes and variations on Le Roi des rues chaudes. Two versions entitled Le Sang (Le Roi) des rues chaudes. With corrections. 53 p., divided into approximately 4 sections; 21 p., 7 p., 19 p. and 6 p.
Autograph manuscript with corrections. A later ver- sion of IV.28.4. 24 p., numbered 1-24.
Autograph manuscript heavily corrected. Probably an earlier version than IV 28.3. 46 p., numbered 1-44.
Autograph manuscript fragment, with corrections 8 p., numbered 45-52 in pen, with pencil numbers 56-64 (missing 62) written over in ink
Autograph manuscript with many corrections 9 p., numbered 1-9. [Related to: Novelle colle Labbra tinte , 1930.]
Autograph manuscript, with corrections, accompanied by 2 pages of comments by LMB. 103 p., numbered 1-104, missing p. 70-75.
Autograph manuscript notes for a book about Russia (never published, according to LMB). With cor- rections and drawings. 107 p., varying sizes
Autograph manuscript notes for a book on Russia "Russia" written at the top of pages [1-45] 90 p., varying sizes

Autograph manuscript notes about saints' days, 1 page with the heading "La fête de St. Jean Baptiste à Génes" followed by four pages with the heading "La fête de Santa Lucia à Naples" (accompanied by a drawing of a church), and 35 pages of various miscellaneous notes. A newspaper clipping c. 1932 is enclosed with these notes, and is entitled "I santi dei giuocatori del lotto in Sicilia." 40 p., of varying sizes, not including a 1-page newspaper clipping of an article

Manuscript in an unidentified hand, possibly that of FTM. The title appears on the top of p. 1, and the abbreviated version "Sant'Elia" in FTM's hand, is on the verso of the last page. With corrections in the same hand as the text. 27 p., numbered [1]-26.
Autograph manuscript notes, with corrections, under the heading "Scherma". 2 p.

Autograph manuscript with title crossed out at the top of page 1. On the verso of the last page is a letter from FTM to Notari asking him to publish this article. Signed on the last page. 11 p., numbers [1]-11 crossed out and replaced by 115-125.

Autograph manuscript notes for a speech addressed to students in Paris. In French and Italian. 2 p.

Autograph manuscript notes, possibly a preface to a speech given in Venice as FTM praises Dottor Nino Barbantini, Director of the Galleria Internazionale d'Arte Moderna in Palazzo Pesaro, Venice. 4 p., numbered 1-4.

Autograph manuscript draft of a speech, with corrections, in which FTM refers to the second and third serate in Milan and Turin (p. 1), the Neapolitan public (p. 2 ff.), and the "Manifesto del futurismo, pubblicato un anno fa dal Figaro [20 Feb 1909]" (p. 27). Incomplete, missing final page(s). Apparently an earlier version of IV.29.22. In Italian. 35 p., numbered [1]-31.
Autograph manuscript draft of a speech, apparently a later copy of IV.29.21, but this version is com- plete. In Italian. 41 p., numbered [1]-41.

Autograph manuscript draft of a speech, with many corrections. The text is untitled and unlabelled, but refers to the "manifesto tecnico" on page 1. In Italian. 30 p. numbered 1-33, missing pp. 22, 23, and 25
Autograph manuscript poem, with title on verso of the last page. Originally entitled Spiralando sul Biancamano. 21 p., numbered 1-21.

On the verso of page 31 in orange and blue pencil (FTM's hand): "Articoli poemi pubblicati". 7 p., numbered 27-33.
Autograph manuscript draft for a letter about Farfa and others, as well as notes for an exhibition review, possibly for the periodical Stile Futurista . 2 p.

Manuscript, possibly in the hand of BCM, with corrections in the hand of FTM. The last 5 pages are typescript, and several typescript paragraphs and sections of pages have been integrated into the manuscript portion. The title appears on the verso of page 12, in FTM's hand. 14 p., numbered 1-14

Autograph manuscript poem. On verso of last page: "Aeropoesie sur Milan". 16 p., numbered 1-16.

Proofs of various poems on tactilism: navigazione tattile, ritratto olfattivo di una donna, macchina lirica, temperature del corpo del nuotatore, paesaggio d'odori del mio cane-lupo, Bombardamento di Adrianopoli, and Si, si, cosi, l'aurora sul mare. All are parole in libertà . A fragment from a collection of FTM's poetry 12 p., numbered 279-290.

Carbon typescript, corresponding to IV.31.3 and 4. Bound in orange paper. 84 p., numbered [1]-84.

Autograph manuscript notes about futurist theater 4 p.
Proofs (?) of an essay by FTM, Emilio Settimelli, and Bruno Corra. Mounted on paper with a few corrections. Published 11 May 1919. 4 p., numbered 1-4.

Typescript with some corrections (probably in BCM's hand). In a yellow folder with FTM's name and title of the essay on the cover, in BCM's hand. Enclosed is a small piece of paper labelled "2a copia" (on the verso, 2 lines of typescript). 112 p., numbered 1-112.
Autograph manuscript outline for a novel. 5 p.

Manuscript in the hand of BCM written in verse form. Signed by FTM on last page. 3 p., numbered 1-3, over which, in pencil, numbered 65-67.

Typescript translation of FTM's work into English by André Tridon Typed on verso of another typescript, a fragment of an introduction to an unknown work about Marxism and capitalism. 5 p., numbered [1]-5.
Autograph manuscript account, in the form of a journal or diary, of Oct 22-27, 1915. With a few corrections. 39 p., numbered 1-32.

did.unittitle: Autograph manuscript notes and a clipping for a book about World War I, including a 1-page drawing/diagram of FTM and Boccioni. 6 p.

Autograph manuscript complete and in order, despite pagination. (First half) First 6 pages are proofs, the rest is manuscript in FTM's hand, with a few corrections. In French. 71 p. some fragments pasted together. Numbered 1-56 bis

Autograph manuscript (Second half) This section begins near the middle of the fifth chapter In French. Some pages are proofs; the whole manu- script with corrections and printing instructions In FTM's hand. 118 p., numbered 57-162. Page 157 includes 2 paragraphs cut from the printed manifesto "L'art des bruits" 1913, Mar 11.

Autograph manuscript preface entitled "La destruction de la syntaxe. L'imagination sans fils Les mots en liberté." Includes most of the printed manifesto "L'imagination sans fils et les mots en liberté" cut up and mounted on paper. Heavily corrected and signed at bottom of last page In French, apparently the French translation of the preface to the 1914 Italian edition of the work Incomplete; title and beginning pages missing Unpublished. 18 p., numbered 1 bis-4 f. Autograph manuscript fragment. See: pp. 112-113 of text. In Italian. 2 p.
Proof of the French version. With corrections Unpublished. 99 p., numbered 21-119.
"Hadirlik" section. 7h marked in FTM's hand in blue pencil. 21 p.
Autograph manuscript notes beginning "Già ho ritornato..." 1 p.
Autograph manuscript notes about art beginning "1474 Michelangelo, 1746 Goya..." 2 p.
Autograph manuscript notes and drawing written on envelope and letter to FTM from a friend (signed "Tua") dated [1916] Dec 10. 6 p., 4 pages on letter plus 2 pages of notes on envelope
Autograph manuscript notes on a postcard with a picture of Villa Ruggi. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript notes for a poem, in French 1 p.
Autograph manuscript notes beginning: "...sabbia del deserto bianco..." 3 p.
Autograph manuscript notes, some mention of "manifesti" and "aeropoeti", at top of second sheet beginning "Le Diabolique". In Italian and French. 3 p.
Autograph manuscript notes for poems. In French Probably ca. 1900. 3 p.
Autograph manuscript notes in French and Italian French page dated at bottom 10 Feb 1898. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript essay in French. Incomplete With many corrections. Beginning: "D'autres groupes..." 5 p.
Autograph manuscript notes, including mention of "aeropoesia". In Italian. 2 p.
Autograph manuscript notes. In Italian. The heading on one page reads: "Gli eccentrici". 2 p.
Autograph manuscript notes beginning: "Il massimo dell'espressione..." 1 p.
Autograph manuscript notes with comments on America and New York. 4 p.
Autograph manuscript notes from a diary, dated Nov/Dec 1927, 4 p.
Autograph manuscript notes in Italian, 23 leaves.
"Voleuse! Salope!..." the first words of an auto- graph transcript fragment from a play, numbered p. 60. 1 p.
Autograph manuscript notes pertaining to Africa including clipping by FTM entitled "In idrovolante con Scipione l'Africane e Salambô" 39 p., numbered 3-41.
Fragment of an autograph manuscript novel about a character "Roseau". 7 p., numbered 1-7.
Fragment of an autograph manuscript about a character named "Roseau". 223 p., numbered 40-262.
Fragment of an unpublished autograph manuscript about a character "Roseau". 42 p., numbered 311-352.
Fragment of an autograph manuscript, in Italian and French. 235 p., numbered 107-342.
Mar 14, Linguistic notes and thoughts on Marx:
May 3, Theory of value, state patriotism. (WW 1)
1916 Feb 13-14 "Occhi lenti che si fermano" Mar 23, a thiene
May 16 "Penso a serivere un libro simultaneo"
Sep 23 "piaceri dello spirito" per "8 anime in una bomba"
(1918) Dec 11-12 "A Roma si prepara fascio Romano"
Materials found with diaries: Five clippings
Comando della Zona di Gorizia "Ai Comandi dipendenti"
"Gli anarchici la dimostrata fatalità", first line of the incomplete proofs of an article on FTM. 28 p., numbered 2-29.
"L'artigliere meccanico", the title of a manuscript poem, with a few corrections, in an unidentified hand. In FTM's hand, in blue pencil, over part of p. 1: " Poesia 12"
"Culinario o Cucinario?," essay on futurist cooking ideas and language. Typescript corrected 4 p.
"Danza delle Schiave" and "Canto di Cabilla", the titles of two typescript poems, both dated 1940 Jul 18. On the top of page 1, a crossed-out note in FTM's hand. 1 p.
Diary, a carbon typescript with entries from Nov 1920-Jun 1924. First paragraph in Spanish, last paragraph is manuscript, in Russian; the rest of the text is in Italian. 8 p.
"elezioni del 1913: 'Italia sovrana assoluta...'", first words of a manuscript fragment of an article on FTM, in an unidentified hand. 6 p., numbered 2-7.
"La fontana di Rimini", the title of a manuscript poem in an unidentified hand. Labelled in blue pencil at the top of page 1 "c. 10", thus probably published in Poesia . 8 p.

did.unittitle: "Frammenti dell'Iperione", the title of a manuscript poem (fragment) in an unidentified hand, with "c. 12" written in blue pencil at the top. Thus probably published in Poesia . 1 p.

"Origini del 'verso libero' in Italia..." the first words of a manuscript outline in an unidentified hand. Organized according to chapters; according to LMB this is a draft for the Congresso Futurista. 2 p.
"Memoria per i giury nella vertenza Pirazzoli- Belli", the title of a typescript with a few corr- ections. Signed at the bottom of p. 8. 10 p.
