did.unittitle: "Il I Congresso di Medicina dello sport..." the first words of a typescript essay signed at the bottom of the page. On the verso, in the hand of FTM, 1 page of notes and the title "Sport femminile" 1 p.
"Boccioni e la Modernolatria", typescript poem in three parts, with name typed at the bottom of page 2. 2 p.
"Sposalizio di Neve", typescript poem, signed at the bottom. 1 p.
"L'antitradition futuriste", autograph manuscript notes for the manifesto of this title, with many corrections, signed. 10 p., dated 1913 Jun 29
"L'antitradition futuriste", proof with corrections for the manifesto of this title. Corrections by Apollinaire and FTM. 4 p.
"Malaparte", draft, typescript carbon, of a play in three acts. Bound in blue cover. 138 p., including title-page, numbered 1-134.
"2 Novembre 1801- Visita a Boccioni", autograph manu- script essay, signed and dated at the bottom of page 2 1931 Nov 7. 2 p.

"Poema delle Penne Nere di Spagna", autograph manu- script poem, signed and dated Rome, Aprile [1938] Last word of title changed from "Guadalajara" to "Spagna". Note at bottom of title-page indicates that it was approved by FTM for the "Mostra Nazionale di Poesia" [1938] 13 p., including title-page, numbered 1-12.
"nato a Pallanza nel 1895 e laureato in legge all'universita di Torino...", first words of a manuscript biographical essay on Azari. Written on telegram forms. 2 p.
"L'Amba Aradam", the title of an autograph manu- script essay signed at the bottom of the last page 11 p.
"Energia futurista italiana..." first words of an autograph manuscript essay. 4 p.
"I Poeti futuristi", a typescript carbon essay dated 1929, signed on p. 1 by Bellonzi and others Apparently copy 2, with corrections throughout by Bellonzi and FTM. 318 p., numbered I-IX, 1-285.
"A Sant'Elia", autograph manuscript, signed at the bottom of the last page. 18 p., numbered [1]-18.

"L'Ospite in Montagna dal romanzo inedito Saturno scenario. On the top of page 1 in blue pencil (in FTM's hand) " Prosa 12"; possibly published in Poesia . Signed on the last page. 10 p., numbered [1]-10.
"La Fiorita" di Riccardo Forster manuscript essay. "Fuochi Montani" on page 1, possibly in the hand of FTM 3 p., numbered 1-3.

"Ho l'onore di salutarla...", first words of an autograph manuscript draft of an address given by Benn at the banquet of the Scrittori Nazionali Tedeschi. With corrections in the hand of FTM, and these comments on verso of the last page: "Discorso di Gottfrid Benn al Banchetto offerto dai Scrittori nazionali tedeschi a S. E. Marinetti sul Palazzo della Stampa di Berlino." Dated by FTM on page 1: Mar 29, 1934. 9 p., numbered [1]-9.

"Le lys intérieur", the title of a group of 4 autograph manuscript poems: "Les cierges", dated 1903; "Les vitraux", dated 1904; "Communion", dated 1905; and "Soleil mourant", dated 1906; signed at the bottom of the last poem. With corrections. 4 p.
"Centaure et faune", the title of an autograph manuscript poem signed at the bottom of the page In blue pencil at top of page in FTM's hand: "Versi c. 12", possibly published in Poesia . 1 p.
A pencil drawing of a head signed on lower left and dated XVI [1938] Apr 28. 1 p.
"La Bayadère", autograph manuscript poem. Unsigned, (part of the same series as V.2.12), 1 p.
"L'Inde magique", autograph manuscript poem, signed at the bottom of the page. 1 p.
"Renoncement", a typescript poem, signed at the bottom of page 2, with editorial and layout instructions in the hand of FTM in blue pencil on page 1. 2 p.
"Partenza", autograph manuscript poem dedicated to FTM. Labelled in blue pencil at the top of page 1 in FTM's hand "c. 12". 2 p.
"La Visita", autograph manuscript poem signed at the bottom and dated 1903. "c. 12" at top of page in blue pencil. 1 p.
"Brouillard, paradis du tourment" the title of a poem, copied by FTM, with title and author at the top of page 1. 6 p., numbered 1-6.
"Una Piazza dove parla Mussolini (parole in libertà)", autograph manuscript poem, signed at the bottom of page 2. 2 p.

"Aeropoesia per Aeropittura", autograph manuscript poem, with underlining in various colors and corr- ections in the same hand. Signed at the bottom of the last page and dated Rome, 2 Jan 1938, "Mostra d'Aeropittura futurista". 5 p.
"Affari - Porto di Genova", autograph manuscript poem, with title and underlinings in various colors. Unsigned, but same format and hand as V.2.18. 10 p.
"I Bersaglieri", autograph manuscript poem, published, with some variations, in Buzzi's Selecta (Edizioni Impronta, 1955) p. 65. 1 p.
"I bovari", autograph manuscript poem, unsigned but in hand similar to V.2.20. 2 p., numbered 1-2.
"Il canto dei Reclusi", autograph manuscript poem in five parts. Published with two additional sections in I Poeti Futuristi (Edizioni Futuriste di "Poesia", 1912) p. 116-119. 6 p., numbered 1-6.
"Concerto di Cane", autograph manuscript poem. A note at the bottom of the last page reads: "dagli Echi del zabiruta
"Golfo di Napoli", autograph manuscript poem with title, underlining and asterisks in red. Signed on last page and dated Milan 1936. 20 p.
"Inno alla poesia nuova", autograph manuscript poem, published in I Poeti Futuristi (1912) p. 105-8. 7 p., numbered 1-7.
"Marcia per cornamuse", autograph manuscript poem with title and asterisks in various colors. Notes and addresses on verso of the last page in the hand of FTM, crossed out in blue pencil. 3 p.
"Marinetti Poeta", autograph manuscript essay heavily corrected. 9 p., numbered 1-9.
"Pauvres", autograph manuscript poem, translated into French, in the hand of FTM. From the original "Poveri". Signed at bottom of page 2 and corrected by FTM. 2 p.
"Stornellata Ditirambica", autograph manuscript poem, with notations and additions in the same hand. Signed at the bottom of the last page and dated Milan, Jul 1937. 11 p.
"Estetica della Amicizia Italiana di Guerra", autograph manuscript manifesto, with corrections, signed at bottom of page 2 and on verso. Notes in the hand of FTM on verso of page 2. 3 p.

p.ref: See also: Series IV, Box 24, folder 1301

did.unittitle: "1a Notte Filtrata", manuscript essay, signed at the bottom of page 9. The hand is similar to that of FTM. 9 p., numbered 1-9.
"Opacità di vecchia latta inverniciata", autograph manuscript poem, signed at the bottom of page 2 and, in FTM's hand, on the verso of the last page. 2 p.

p.ref: See also: Series IV, Box 30, folder 1451

did.unittitle: "Razzo cielo-terra", autograph manuscript poem signed on the last page and dated Milan, 29 May 1925. Note at the end in author's hand: "(dal poema parolibera 'Femmine da teatro')". On the verso of page 3 many notes in the hand of FTM are crossed out. 4 p., numbered 1-3.
"Vita di un filo d'erba", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page, dated Milan, 12 Jan 1924. 4 p.
"Aracne", autograph poem, signed on the last page 3 p.

"Risposta all'inchiesta di ' Poesia ' sul verso libero", autograph manuscript letter, signed at the bottom of page 4; "Prosa c. 10" written in FTM's hand in blue pencil at top of page 1. 4 p. Followed by a 3-page autograph manuscript letter on the same subject, beginning "Rispondero cumulativemente alle due domande..." and signed on the retro of first page. Sent from Lugano and dated 11 Jan 1905. 3 p.
"Je vous ai assiegé", autograph manuscript poem, signed. Title and notes, as well as "c. 12," in red pencil in FTM's hand. 1 p.
"Morte di un eroe, parole in libertà", typescript poem with notes by FTM. 1 p.
"Il saluto degli integralisti Rumeni di Futuristi Italiani", typescript of an address given to Italian futurists, with corrections in the author's hand. 4 p., numbered [1]-4.
"Cantico della Volubilità", typescript poem, signed on the last page. 3 p.

"Parlare, scrivere di Marinetti..." the first words of a proof, with corrections, of an essay on FTM dated May 1961, accompanied by a 2-page autograph manuscript letter from BCM. 12 p., 10 pages of proofs, 2 pages of letter
"Esistono oggi in Italia... " the first words of an autograph manuscript address to FTM, signed and dated on the last page 14 Jun [1942]. 6 p., numbered [1]-6.
"Fumando un Peasaggio," printed version, in unidentified newspaper

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: (on opposite side is printed an article by FTM titled "[word missing] Futurista")

did.unittitle: "Ossecorp la Noub Osnes", typescript carbon of a play, dedicated to FTM, and signed on the last page. Dedication in manuscript on page [1]. Also a second copy, in proof form, with no corrections, but with "Bragagia" written in FTM's hand on the first page 37 p., numbered [1]-23 and [1]-8.
"Poésie", autograph manuscript poem signed on the last page. On the versos of the last two pages, two letters from FTM to BCM. 6 p.
"Piedi Nudi", a typescript dialogue between FTM and various Italian newspapers 2 p.
"Romanticismo Futurista", autograph manuscript play, signed on last page and accompanied by a cover letter to FTM, dated 2 Feb 1919 and signed at the bottom. 30 p., numbered [1]-25.
"Boccioni e il dinamismo plastico" the title of a carbon typescript with corrections in the author's hand. Signed on the last page. 10 p., numbered [1]-10.
"Fragment de la fuite d'anthrope", autograph manuscript poem, signed at the top of the page, with "12" written in blue pencil on top left corner. Possibly published in Poesia . 1 p.
"Fuochi d'Artificio", a carbon typescript poem with name at bottom, and heading: "Littoriali femminili anno XVIII; Gara/composizione poetica; Guf Ferrara; La Presente Lirica e'inedita." 1 p.
"La Mélodie incarnée", autograph manuscript poem, signed. 1 p.
"Corps et âme", poem, copied in FTM's hand, probably taken from Flouquet's Corps et Ame (Brussels, Les Cahiers du "Journal des Poètes", 1933) pp. 52-53. 4 p., numbered 1-4.
"Ulysse", poem, copied in the hand of FTM. 9 p., numbered 1-9.

"Le bohémien", manuscript poem, with corrections in the hand of the author and editorial notations in the hand of FTM Dedicated to FTM. "c. 10" written in blue pencil at the top of page 1, Probably published in Poesia , 2 p.

"Les voiles de mon navire", a two-part autograph manuscript poem (I, Le départ; II, L'arrivée) under the heading "Ballades françaises" ("du 'Livre des visions'") with editorial instructions in the author's hand."c. 12 Prosa" in blue pencil at top of page 1, 3 p., numbered 68-70.
"Il successo delle semirappresentazioni teatrali alle Stanze del Libro di Roma," printed version, Autori e Scrittori

"Il vagabondo del mio sogno", typescript poems and prose with corrections in the author's hand. Bound in hard-cover linen. 118 p., 5 pages of introduction in form of a poem; 112 p. of text numbered 1-112.
"Raglia", the first word of an autograph poem, signed. 1 p.

"Trois esquisses lyriques: I, allégorie; II, Ritournelle; III, Cri d'Ariane (fragment)" the title of an autograph manuscript poem, signed at the bottom of page 3 and dated 1905. "c. 12" in blue pencil at top of page 1. 3 p.

"Contadini e aeropoeti futuristi di Godrano", poems dedicated to FTM and bound in an orange folder, with title printed on cover. Signed on page 90 and on page 96, and dated Jan 1942. 98 p., including orange cover.
"Marinetti", autograph manuscript poem signed at the bottom of the last page and dated Jun 1927. 3 p.
"Sant'Elia, Architetto del Futuro", autograph manuscript poem with highlights in colored crayons. 7 p., numbered [I]-VII
"L'altana", autograph manuscript poem, signed and dated Sep 1905. 2 p.
"Elogio del Sonetto", autograph manuscript poem, signed. 1 p.
"Nuit d'étoiles", typescript poem with corrections, signed. In blue pencil at the top: "c. 12 versi"; possibly published in Poesia . 1 p.
"Manifesto degli operai futuristi", autograph manuscript manifesto, signed. 5 p., numbered 1-5.

"Processo contro S. E. Benito Mussolini e 38 arditi combattenti e fascisti Milanesi per complotto contro la sicurezza dello stato - 16 Nov l919 - Milano", typescript of the proceedings. Dated 10 May 1920. 10 p., numbered [1]-10.
"Attimo di meraviglia", autograph manuscript poem signed and dated 1922. Janelli's name added to the title possibly in FTM's hand 1 p.
"Officiale d'Ispezione" (parole in libertà), printed version, in unidentified newspaper
"Le Fouzi-Yama", autograph manuscript prose-poem "c. 10" written at top in blue pencil; possibly published in Poesia . Signed on page 2. 2 p.

"Le lyricisme militariste, spéculations, sollicitudes attendries et obstinées envers les soldats militaires", autograph manuscript essay, signed on the last page. "10..." written in blue pencil at the top of page 1; possibly published in Poesia . 4 p., numbered 1-4.
"Théâtre mirlitonesque", proofs of Ubu Colonial with many corrections in the hand of the author Signed on the cover title. 19 p., numbered [1]-16.
"Théâtre mirlitonesque", the title of some proofs, with many corrections. The last page pasted to the verso of the title-page of La Revue Blanche vol. XXI, 1900. 13 p.
"Anniversaire", two versions of a poem. The first version is 18 lines, the second is 30 lines. Both versions signed and dated, the first dated 1899, the second 1901 Dec 11. 3 p.

"La beauté italienne qu'en dire...", the first words of an untitled autograph manuscript essay Possibly from ca. 1905, when FTM was collecting writings on Italian women for Poesia . Signed on page 2. 2 p.
"Clemenceau intime", autograph manuscript essay, with corrections. Note in FTM's hand on top of page 1. Signed on the last page. 17 p., numbered 1-17.
"Lettre à...(?)", the heading of a letter addressed to "Amie" probably published in Poesia as "corp. 12" is written in blue pencil on page 1. Signed by Kahn on page 2. 2 p., numbered 1-2.
"Palais de songe", autograph manuscript poem, signed twice at the bottom. 1 p.
"Le refuge des amoureux", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. 3 p., numbered 1-3.

"Quarta dimensione di un'attesa di donna", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. Dedicated to W. S., and published in F. T. Marinetti presenta i nuovi poeti futuristi (Rome, Edizioni Futuriste di "Poesia", 1925) pp. 84-87. 10 p., numbered 1-10.
"Danger de mort", the title of a book from which these excerpts have been copied by FTM. 7 p.
"Minute", a poem copied by FTM from Le visage dans la brume (Liège, Belgium, Editions "Anthologie", n.d.) p. 32-33. 3 p., numbered 1-3.
"F. T. Marinetti, poema futurista", autograph manuscript poem, including a quotation from FTM's "Mafarka il Futurista". Signed on the last page. 4 p.
"Il Futurismo - la nuova religione dell'umanità 60 p. (54-60 blank).

"Sinfonia Colorata", autograph manuscript scenario, with D'Annunzio, FTM and Mussolini in the roles of Aquila, Pantera and Leone respectively. Signed and dated on the last page: "Magamal fratello del Re Africano Mafarka" 19-21 Jan 1920. 12 p.
Le Forze Umane , publicity broadside, titled "Una Nuova Scrittrice Futurista" by Paolo Buzzi
"L'Abissinia in guerra illustra e spiega La teoria delle parole in libertà", autograph manuscript essay. Written in the same hand as La Radio Futur- ista, IV.27.15. 8 p.

"Raccolta di poesie futuriste fatte da Masnata", a group of poems in an unidentified hand, dated on the last page "Foligno Giugno 1927 Villa Leandra". Title-page and last page in the hand of FTM. 38 p., each group numbered separately.
"Fiume", autograph manuscript essay, signed at the bottom of the last page. 20 p., including cover title, numbered 1-19.
"Forêt", autograph manuscript poem, signed on page 2. 2 p.
"Crépuscule", autograph manuscript poem signed on page 2. "c. 12" written in blue pencil at the top of page l; probably published in Poesia . 2 p.
"Note biografiche", typescript essay on his life, with underlining and asterisks. 1 p.

"Elfride", the title of an autograph manuscript essay, signed on the last page and dedicated to the "noble poète Valère Brussov". In blue pencil at the top of page 1, "c. 10 Prosa"; probably published in Poesia . 20 p., numbered 1-20.
"Deux poèmes: Ta voix; Le pays", two autograph manuscript poems, signed on the last page Probably published in Poesia , as a blue "12" is at the top of page 1 and 2. 3 p.
"L'émotion nouvelle", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page, and dedicated to Cyrille Besset. "Prosa c. 12" written at top of page 1; probably published in Poesia . 3 p., numbered 1-3.
"La Guardia al Brennero", typescript, with corr- ections, signed on the last page, and dated Rome 8 Feb 1926. 8 p.

"Stipes", proofs of a collection of poems. Two copies; the first, with autograph manuscript dedication to FTM, signed and dated Mar 1930. 108 p., the first copy on very delicate paper. Also enclosed is an envelope with "Stipes" written on the cover
"La douceur du matin", proofs of a poem, with many editorial corrections and comments. Signed at the end of the poem. "c. 12" written on page 1; probably intended for Poesia . 3 p.
"L'Aeropoema del Golfo di Taranto," autograph manuscript poem, dedicated to FTM and signed on the title-page and on the last page. Dated 5 Sep 1940. 39 p., including cover title, numbered [1]-37.
"Il Controdolore, manifesto futurista," autograph manuscript with corrections. 20 p., numbered in upper right corner 1-17 bis
"Jamais le monde..." the first words of a poem copied in FTM's hand from the author's Deluge (Brussels, Les Cahiers du "Journal des Poetes", 1933) pp. 26-28. 6 p., numbered 1-6.
Color reproduction of Prampolini's design for the set of FTM's play "Prigionieri"
Color reproduction of Prampolini's design, "La Macchina fermalava" for the second act of FTM's play, "Vulcani" 2 copies

Typed letter to FTM, with an addendum including two propositions to add to a manifesto. Signed by Raimondi, Giuseppe Rizzo, Agostino di Stefano, and Vito Corona, dated 10 Feb 1923. The addendum signed only by Raimondi. 2 p.
"Palazzo", an autograph manuscript poem, with corrections, signed on the last page. In French 4 p.
"Fragment", autograph manuscript poem, signed "c. 12" in blue at the top of the page; probably published in Poesia . 1 p.
"Colonnes", a poem copied by FTM. 4 p., numbered 1-4.
"Effets", autograph manuscript poem, signed at the bottom of page with note: "(La vie unanime II, 11)" "12" written in blue at the top of page 1; probably published in Poesia . 2 p.
"Contra els poetes amb minuscula, primer manifest catala futurista", printed version of this manifest In Catalan. 1 p. [NOS 8-20-87, 1-29-90, 10-5-94]
"L'architecture futuriste, manifeste du 11 juillet 1914", a typescript manifesto, with corrections 7 p., numbered 1-7.
"Aspirazioni", autograph manuscript poem. Signed on last page and on page 1. Published in Sanzin's Accenti e Quote (Edizioni Futuriste di "Poesia", 1935) p. 11-12. 5 p., numbered [1]-5.
"Da 'Ottimismo ad ogni costo' si muore...", auto- graph manuscript poem (?) signed on last page 8 p., numbered 1-8.
"Il Duce vuole", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. Published in Accenti e Quote (Edizioni Futuriste di "Poesia", 1935), p. 13-14. 4 p., numbered 6-9.
"Eroica", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. Published in Accenti e Quote , p. 17-18. 4 p., numbered 10-13.
"Goal", the title of an autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. Published in Accenti e Quote , p. 59-60. 5 p., numbered 22-26.
"1000 HP", the title of an autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. Published in Accenti e Quote , p. 55-56. 8 p., numbered 14-21.
"Sprazzi e Guizzi Lirici", typed poem, signed on p. [1] and [2]. with corrections. 26 p.
"Anatomia lirica d'un numero di Varietà", an auto- graph manuscript poem, signed on the last page, and dedicated to Loris Catrizzi. 4 p., numbered [1]-4.
"Galleria di Milano", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. 2 p., numbered [1]-2.
"Mare-Donna", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. 2 p., numbered [1]-2.
"Meteora di guerra", autograph manuscript poem, signed on the last page. 2 p., numbered [1]-2.
"M. G. Spano", autobiographical note, written on a telegram sheet. 1 p.

"Premessa: L'avversario considera abilita politica..." the first words of a typescript manifesto (?), unsigned, with autograph manu- script corrections in an unidentified hand, but on Spedizione Keller 1929 letterhead. 3 p.
"Je suis une ombre parmi les ombres", typed poem Translated into French by Christophe A. Jezewski 28 p., numbered 1-27.
"Tuberie", autograph manuscript poem, signed at the top of page 1. 6 p., numbered 1-6.

p.ref: See also: Series IV, Box 33, folder 1526

did.unittitle: "Senso Occulto nella 'conquista delle stelle' di FTM", the title of typescript fragment of an essay, the first part of which is in three copies. Copy 1 includes a photograph pasted onto verso of page 1 labelled "Marcanti". 36 p., numbered [1]-16; [1]-11; [1]-5.

"L'Amore mediterraneo, manifesto futurista", type- script manifesto with many autograph manuscript corrections. Name typed on last page followed by autograph manuscript: "del gruppo futurista Milanese Umberto Boccioni". Notes on verso of last page in hand of the author and of FTM. 3 p.
"Medium", autograph manuscript poem, in Italian, signed. "c. 12" written in blue pencil at top; probably published in Poesia . 1 p.
"Le 'Musicalisme' ", autograph manuscript essay, signed on the last page. Editorial comments in FTM's hand at top of page 1. Possibly published in Poesia . 8 p, numbered 1-8.

"Rome à travers le temps et l'espace", autograph manuscript essay, with corrections. Note: "peint en 1923, exposé au Salon des Indépendants de Paris, en 1924". In red pencil in FTM's hand "c/10 corsivo". 2 p.

[Le Partage du sommeil], title of a poem, a fragment of which is here copied in the hand of FTM. Taken from the author's Le sommeil du laboureur (Brussels, Les Cahiers du "Journal des Poètes", 1932), p. 24. 3 p., numbered 1-3.

"Città ferma, Sciopero generale ", autograph manuscript poem, with author's name on last page, possibly in FTM's hand Published in Vecchi's Ponti sull'Oceano (Edizioni Futuriste di "Poesia", 1914), p. 9-13. 8 p., numbered 1-8.
"Prima Rappresentazione", autograph manuscript poem The author's name appears on the last page, possibly in FTM's hand. Published in Ponti sull'Oceano , p. 135-140. 7 p., numbered 1-7.
"Strada notte Folla", autograph manuscript poem Author's name on last page, possibly in FTM's hand; published in Ponti sull'Oceano p. 123-25. 5 p., numbered 1-5.
"Salone d'Albergo", autograph manuscript poem Author's name written on last page possibly in FTM's hand. Published in Ponti sull'Oceano p. 157-162. 7 p., numbered 1-7.
"Sarcophage", autograph manuscript poem, with a few corrections, signed. In upper right corner, possibly in FTM's hand, "Corpo 9". 1 p.
"Puisque nous voilà..." autograph manuscript poem, signed on page 2. "12" written in blue pencil at top of page 1; probably published in Poesia . 2 p.
"'Collezione Storia e Pensiero': Dal Verso Libero all'Aeropoesia", the title of an autograph manu- script outline for an essay. 3 p., numbered 1-3.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Series IV, Box 24, folder 1312 and Series IV, Box 25, folder 1315

did.unittitle: "Il patto" 1917 Nov 21; "La Leggenda del Silenzio" 1917 Nov; "Il mio principe azzurro" 1918 Feb; "Il mio io" 1918 Jan; four autograph manuscript poems, unsigned. The first was originally enclosed in an envelope addressed to BCM postmarked 1929 Sep 10. 16 p., not including envelope

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These works, formerly boxes 33-35, have been catalogued in the Yale Library's bibliographic database.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These works, formerly boxes 36-37, have been catalogued in the Yale Library's bibliographic database.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs Documenting the Life of F.T. Marinetti The photographs are organized in chronological order, year preceding month and day. If the date is question- able, it is followed by a question mark and, when needed, an explanation is appended to the text. Related photos may be found in the following sub- series, Futurist Photographs, Photographs of Works of Art, and Other postcards and photographs/without FTM or Futurists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Abbreviations: FTM - Filippo Tommaso Marinetti BCM - Benedetta Cappa Marinetti LMB - Luce Marinetti Barbi

did.unittitle: 1. Alexandria, Egypt. FTM (far left), his father and his older brother in the family home. Inscribed by LMB on verso: "Il nonno Marinetti alla sua destra papa bambino alla sinistra lo zio Leone - nella casa di Alessandria d'Egitto," and, in another hand, "Marinetti."
2. FTM as an adolescent. Inscribed on verso in several hands: "Marinetti: ragazzo," "figura," and various markings for publication.
3. FTM, with a cloth on his head, at the edge of a large body of water Inscribed on verso in different hands: "Marinetti" and "in [illegible]."
4. FTM's wrecked car in a ditch Inscribed by LBM on verso: "La macchina di papa - nel fossato - 1 man. fut. -LBM."
5. FTM (portrait photo) in straw hat and gloves.
6. Paris. FTM with Gustave Kahn. Inscribed by LBM on verso: "FTM and Gustave Kahn." Stamped on verso: "Copyright. - World's Graphic Press Paris. 39, Rue de Châteaudun, Paris."
7. FTM in a close-up photo of his face. Inscribed on verso: "F.T. Marinetti."
8. Battaglione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Unidentified soldier next to bicycle

9. Gallarate or Brescia. Battaglione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automo- bilisti. Group portrait with Boccioni in center wearing light jacket and darker pants. Russolo? to the right of Boccioni, Piatti? kneeling, and Sant'Elia to the left of Boccioni.

10. Peschiera. Battaglione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. FTM (kneeling at the right side of the photo) in a group of soldiers, some in costumes made of leaves. Boccioni? behind FTM and Sant'Elia kneeling (nearest the camera on the right).

11. Peschiera. Battaglione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti. FTM (seated on ground in center, wearing hat and smoking) in a group watching as one man pretends to execute another. Boccioni is seated to the right of FTM.
12. Peschiera. Battaglione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti. FTM (seated on ground) in group watching as one man dances. Boccioni also seated on ground.
13. Schio (southeast of Rovereto). Battaglione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. FTM, smoking, standing before buildings. Inscribed on verso in blue pencil: "a Schio."
14. Duplicate of n. 13 Inscribed on verso: "Schio."

15. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Sant'Elia standing before a tent. Postcard. Inscribed on verso: "Sant'Elia?" and "yes mm" [Marianne Martin?], and, in another hand, "Marinetti."
16. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Left to right: Carra, unidentified man, FTM (seated), Sant'Elia, and an unidentified man.

17. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Left to right: Sant'Elia, FTM, unidentified man, Carra, unidentified man. Inscribed on verso: "FTM with Sant'Elia and Carra WWI."
18. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Mario Sironi (in fleece-lined cap), FTM, and Boccioni (right of FTM) with three unidentified men.
19. Duplicate of n. 18. Enlargement. Inscribed on paper attached to bottom of photo: "Marinetti ed i futuristi volontari al front - guerra 1914- 1918."
21. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Left to right: Battaini, Boccioni and FTM, cutting trees.
22. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. FTM and others walking along a path.
23. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Left to right: FTM, Erba, unidentified man, Boccioni, and Battaini.
24. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Left to right: FTM, Boccioni and Battaini.
25. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. Left to right: FTM, Battaini, unidentified man and Boccioni, warming hands over fire.
26. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. FTM and Boccioni with three unidentified men and a mule.
27. Mountains near Rovereto. Batta- glione Lombardo Volontari Ciclisti Automobilisti. FTM, Boccioni and four unidentified men with a machine gun.
29. Mountains near Rovereto. Landscape view. Inscribed on verso: "Paese di Rotzo nei franchi del monte Campolongo. Val d'Assa."
30. Mountains near Rovereto. Landscape view. Inscribed on verso: "Strada che va a Castelpolto nei franchi del Monte Campolongo Val d'Assa."
31. Mountains near Rovereto. Landscape view. Inscribed on verso: "[illegible] Val Astico e Val d'Assa."
32. Mountains near Rovereto. Landscape view. Inscribed on verso: "Batteria 334. Panega."
33. Man lying on ground with a machine gun.
35. Man with a fox on a leash.
36. Man with a fox on his head.
37. FTM standing before a hut with a larger house in the background.
41. Artillery piece. Inscribed on verso: "Casa Soroccata? di Panega... Batteria 236 Capetana Narni?."
42. Dead man hanging in a tree.
46. Soldiers bathing at edge of lake.
47. Soldiers bathing at edge of lake.
48. Soldiers bathing at edge of lake.
49. Valsugana (north of Rovereto). Soldiers [including FTM?]. Inscribed on verso in three different hands: "Giulio Marchi Firenze 19/2/17," "Sugana," and "a Marinetti."
50. Dolina Messina. FTM and seven other men. Inscribed and dated on bottom.
51. Dolina Messina. Inscribed and dated on bottom.
52. Dolina Messina. Two unidentified men seated on a bench.
53. Dolina Messina. Two men and a sign.
54. Dolina Messina. Three men on stairs.
55. Dolina Messina. Unidentified man in the dolina.
56. Dolina Messina. FTM and three other men before a hut.
57. Dolina Messina. FTM standing before a hut.
59. Mosson. FTM and others in a field. Inscribed on verso: "Mosson, Giugno 1918" and "Libro Lasnata?."
60. Genova. FTM on the balcony of the house of Professor Bruschettini. Inscribed on verso in blue pencil: "Genova balcone del Prof. Bruschettini Luglio 1918."

62. Turin. FTM standing next to his portrait by Rougena Zatkova. Stamped on verso: "...Reportage....Ottolenghi... Torino." [Reproduced and dated 1918 by Giovanni Lista in Futurisme: Manifestes - Documents - Proclamations (1973), after p. 160.]

67. Milan. Paolo Buzzi in his garden standing before a statue of Apollo. Inscribed on verso: "Paolo Buzzi nel suo giardino in via [illegible] 32 Milano, davanti alla [illegible] Apollo. anno 1924."

162. Bologna. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni) and Angelo Caviglioni seated on the floor of a Futurist exhibition. Inscribed on verso: "Tato e Caviglioni alla Esp. futurista di Bologna." [Photo reproduced in Tato RacconTato da Tato (Milan, 1941), fig. 4. This date is published in Lista, Futurisme: Mani- festes - Documents - Proclamations (1973).]

163. Bologna. Duplicate of n. 162. Inscribed on verso: "I pittori futur- isti Tato e Caviglioni alla Esposi- zione di Bologna," and, in another hand, "ca. 1932-33 Tato & Caviglioni." [See: reference information above.]

164. Bologna. Futurist paintings, sculpture, furniture and parole-in- libertà at a Futurist exhibition as seen in n. 162 and n. 163. Inscribed on verso: "Sala futurista di Tato e Caviglioni." [See: reference inform- ation above.]
165. Bologna. Duplicate of n. 164. [See: reference information above.]

RacconTato da Tato , Milan, 1941, fig. 1.]

168. Rome. FTM, BCM, Depero (on ottoman), Mazza (behind BCM) and others (from the back, far left) Luciano Folgore, Remo Chiti, and Enrico Prampolini at FTM's apartment. Boccioni's Footballer on wall. [Giovanni Lista, in his Marinetti e le futurisme , dates a related photo 1926.]
169. Rome. FTM (behind Mazza), Folgore, Prampolini, Depero (to the left of FTM), BCM and others at FTM's apartment. [See: reference information above.]

173. Modena. FTM talking in a group of young men. Inscribed on verso: "Arditi di Modena."
174. FTM portrait photo as an Acca- demico d'Italia.

175. Rome?. FTM and other members of the Accademia d'Italia in their uniforms. [This is the date FTM was inducted into the group.] Left to right: Francesco Cilea, Marcello Piacentini, Francesco Copolla, Armando Brasini, Pietro Mascagni, FTM, Umberto Giordano, Ettore Romanoli, Enrico Fermi.
176. Bucarest. FTM with the "Futurists of Bucarest". Inscribed to FTM and autographed by those present on verso. Dated on verso.
177. The Futurist Table. FTM and others seated at table. Stamped on verso: "Photo-Maggio...Tunis."
178. The Futurist Table. The room before the guests arrived. Stamped on verso: "Photo-Maggio...Tunis."
179. The Futurist Table. View of the room (with typewriter). Stamped on verso: "Photo-Maggio...Tunis."
180. The Futurist Table. View of the room (with cogwheel centerpiece). Stamped on verso: "Photo-Maggio... Tunis."
181. The Futurist Table. View of the room (with horse cartoon on wall). Inscribed on verso: "La tavola futur- ista." Stamped on verso: "Photo- Maggio...Tunis."
182. The Futurist Table. View of the room (with bed). Stamped on verso: "Photo-Maggio...Tunis."
183. The Futurist Table. View of the room (with "Tavolta la donna" poster). Stamped on verso: "Photo-Maggio... Tunis."
184. Genoa. FTM with a group of Futurists at a formal reception by the city of Genoa. Depero at far right. Inscribed on verso: "Ricevimento dei futuristi in Municipio." Date stamped on verso.

185. Rome. FTM and an unidentified man in FTM's apartment in Piazza Adriana. Gerardo Dottori's portrait of FTM and family on the wall behind. [See: related photo and additional information in Giovanni Lista's, Balla (1982), p. 247.]

186. Rome. FTM and BCM in their apart- ment in Piazza Adriana, holding FTM's Parole in libertà futuriste olfattive tattili termiche . Portraits of FTM by Depero (left) and Rougena Zatkova (right) hang on the walls. Photo by Luxardo of Rome.

187. Rome. FTM and BCM in their apart- ment in Piazza Adriana, holding FTM's Parole in libertà futuriste olfattive tattili termiche . Portraits of FTM by Depero (left) and Rougena Zatkova (right) hang on the walls. Photo by Luxardo of Rome (slightly cropped).

189. Naples. FTM at a meeting with other men. [Giovanni Lista reproduces a related photo in his Petrolini (1981), p. 42, and identifies those present as FTM, Libero Bovio, G. Nazzaro, and Cangiullo, at the Circolo della stampa, Naples, 1932.]
190. Duplicate of n. 189. [See: reference information above.]
191. Naples. FTM at a meeting, standing and reading. [See: reference information above.]
192. Naples. FTM at a meeting, holding a paper entitled "Premio Roma". [See: reference information above.]

193. Trieste. FTM with Bruno G. Sanzin (far right), Fedele Azari? (lower left), and an unidentified man. Inscribed on verso: "papa ed i futuristi." [Photo- grapher's name and "Trieste" in lower right.]
194. Trieste. FTM with Bruno G. Sanzin (left of FTM) and three unidentified men. Inscribed on verso: "Trieste."
195. Viareggio. FTM with several men at an exhibition. Inscribed on verso: "Con Viani? Viareggio 1932."
196. Viareggio. FTM with several men at an exhibition. Inscribed on verso: "Con Viani? Viareggio 1932."

201. Savona. FTM at the Lito Latta tin factory where the metal covers for his Parole in libertà olfattive tattili termiche were made. Cover designed by Tullio d'Albisola. Inscribed on recto: "S.E. Marinetti all'uscita dello stablim'to. Lito Latta Savona 1-8-1932-X." Inscribed on verso in FTM's hand: "a Savona Lito Latta."

211. Mantua. FTM and Mino Somenzi in a group at the Mostra Nazionale d'Arte Futurista, which opened on this date in the Palazzo Ducale. [See: related photo in Giovanni Lista, Le Livre Futuriste , p. 127, and in Mino Somenzi, Difendo il futurismo (1938), p. 73.]

228. Rome. FTM, BCM, King Vittorio Emanuel III, and Mino Somenzi at the Prima Mostra Nazionale d'Arte Futurista, organized by the news- paper Futurismo . [For related photos and more information on this exhibition, see: Mino Somenzi, Difendo il futurismo (1938).]

234. Genova. FTM in a group at the opening of the Prima Mostra Nazionale di Plastica Murale per l'Edilizia Fascista, held in the Palazzo Ducale. [see the catalogue of this exhibition for a full account of the opening including a list of those present.]

310. Russia. FTM with a peasant woman. Inscribed on verso: "papa in Russia 1942" and "Isba."
311. Russia. FTM looking out of window. Inscribed on verso: "papa in Russia Ott. 1942 nell'Isba."
312. Russia. FTM next to peasant woman and child. Typescript on verso: "11 September 1942."
313. Russia. FTM seated. Typescript on verso: "11 September 1942."
314. Venice. FTM, BCM and Bruno G. Sanzin with others at an art exhibition. Photo processed in Venice.
315. FTM portrait. Photo by Cavalieri of Perugia.
317. Venice. FTM on the balcony of his apartment on the Grand Canal.
318. Tunis?. FTM declaiming onstage. Photo processed in Tunis.
319. Tunis?. FTM declaiming onstage. Photo processed in Tunis.
320. Tunis?. FTM declaiming onstage. Photo processed in Tunis.
321. Tunis?. FTM declaiming onstage. Photo processed in Tunis.
322. FTM speaking. Inscribed on verso: "Marinetti declama aerocanzoni futuristi in un salone aristocratica di [illegible]."
323. Turin?. FTM greeting audience on a theatre stage with other people. Photo processed in Turin.
324. Turin?. Theatre audience. Photo processed in Turin.
325. FTM speaking into a microphone, surrounded by listeners.
326. San Remo?. FTM speaking before an audience. Photo processed in San Remo.
327. A Futurist "evening," showing an aeropainting by Tullio Crali onstage. FTM? at microphone. Inscribed on verso: "quadro di Crali."
329. FTM on a porch with a cat and dog. Inscribed on verso: "Marinetti."

330. FTM next to Boccioni's Develop- ment of a Bottle in Space. Inscribed on verso: "papa di fronte alla bottiglia di Boccioni ora al Museo d'Arte Mod. di N.Y." [papa before Boccioni's Bottle now in the Museum of Modern Art, N.Y.]
331. FTM in front of Boccioni's Footballer and beneath Boccioni's Horse & House (painted sculpture).
332. Alexandre Mercereau. Inscribed: "a l'ami Marinetti cordialement Alex Mercereau."
333. Paolo Buzzi as an adolescent (portrait photo). Inscribed on verso: "Paolo Buzzi studente."
334. Paolo Buzzi as a young man (portrait photo).
335. Warsaw. FTM seated at a banquet of the P.E.N. club. Inscribed on verso: "Banchetta all Pen Club Varsawa?." Photo processed in Warsaw.
336. Capri?. FTM and Prampolini. Inscribed on paper attached to verso: "Marinetti e Prampolini a Capri."
337. FTM next to airplanes and other people.
338. BCM? on an airplane with Mario di Bernardi? and unidentified man.
339. Belgrade. FTM and BCM with others at Taverna Dardanelle. Inscribed on verso: "Taverna Dardanelle a Belgrado."
340. Belgrade. FTM and five unidentified men. Inscribed on verso in FTM's hand: "Nella Direzione di Vreme? a Belgrado."
341. FTM next to a woman [actress?] in a long gown
342. FTM seated in a group of eight men.

343. FTM with several people before a sign, "Fanfulla." two of the men appear in n. 342. [Fanfulla Lari was a violinist. A photo of him with Primo Conti, ca. 1916, is reproduced in Primo Conti, 1911-1980 , Palazzo Pitti exhibition catalogue, 1980-81, p. 62.]
344. FTM with five unidentified men. Two of these men appear in nos. 342 and 343.
345. FTM in a large group with several Indian people.
346. FTM with some of the same people in n. 339.
347. Venice?. FTM walking in a group.
348. Venice?. FTM walking in a group.
349. Venice?. FTM walking in a group.
350. Venice?. FTM walking in a group.
351. Venice?. FTM walking in a group.
352. Naples. FTM with the publisher Casella at the book fair. Inscribed on verso: "S.E. Marinetti con l'Editore Casella alla Stand della festa del Libro a Napoli." [after 1929]
353. A book fair?. FTM? behind another man, holding out his hand.
354. Rome?. FTM in a group. Inscribed on verso: "Banchetta Mistral?." Photo processed in Rome.
355. Rome. FTM and Tato in a group at the inauguration of "Spirito nuovo." Inscribed on verso.
356. Rome. FTM and Tato in a group at the inauguration of "Spirito nuovo." Inscribed on verso.
357. Rome. FTM and Del Vecchio (President of the University of Rome) with students after a conference on Boccioni and FTM's L'Alcova d'Acciaio . Inscribed on verso.
358. Rome. FTM and Del Vecchio (President of the University of Rome) and a group of students after a conference on Boccioni and FTM's L'Alcova d'Acciaio . Inscribed on verso.
359. Lisbon. FTM in a group. Photo processed in Lisbon.
360. Lisbon. FTM in a group. Inscribed on verso: "Lisboua."

361. FTM, Luigi Russolo, and others at table. All are identified in manu- script inscription on recto: "Croci, A. Russolo, Schicklin, L. Russolo, FTM, Sarti, Rossi, Cappellani, Mancuso, Garagnani, Piatti, Russo, Mazzini, Ceria, Campigli, Nunzio." Stamped on verso: "Colonia Italiana di Parigi. Annali Storico - Fotografici. Raucci, Editore."
362. Milan. FTM in a group. Inscribed on verso: "Congresso Federation Societe Gens de Lettres a Milano."
363. Montecatini (eight miles west southwest of Pistoia). FTM seated in a group outdoors. Inscribed on verso in two different hands: "a Montecatini" and "premio letterario."
364. Palermo. FTM (midway down the right side of the table) at a luncheon. Inscribed on verso. [Removed from Marinetti M338Pb cop. 2.]
365. FTM and BCM in an interior.
366. Turin. FTM and BCM with several people. Photo processed in Turin.
367. Bologna? FTM with two men. Aero- painting behind. Inscribed on verso: "Marinetti," "Alberti," [or "Alberto"?] and "Cavaglio." Photo processed in Bologna.
368. FTM, Mino Somenzi and other people at an exhibition of sculpture.
369. FTM and three unidentified men at an exhibition of Aeropainting.
370. FTM and BCM at an exhibition of photographs.
371. Paris. FTM in a crowd at a Futurist exhibition at the Galerie de La Boétie.
372. Paris. FTM in a group at an exhibition at the Galerie de La Boétie. Inscribed on verso: "Parigi [illegible] Rue La Boétie."
373. Lonigo? FTM in a group at the entrance of the Prima Mostra d'Avan- guardia. Inscribed on verso: "Espo- sizione Futurista Lonigo."
374. Lonigo? FTM and others at the Prima Mostra d'Avanguardia. Inscribed on verso: "Esposizione Futurista Lonigo."
375. Fascist art exhibition with a quote by Mussolini on the wall.
376. Prima Mostra d'Arte della Provincia de Littoria (Latina). Three paintings by Dario di Gese and Pierluigi Rossi can be seen in the photo. Inscribed on verso.
377. Mantua. Art exhibition. Inscribed on verso: "Mantova." [Fascist era]
378. Mantua. Art exhibition. Inscribed on verso: "Mantova." [Fascist era]
379. Mantua. Art exhibition. Inscribed on verso: "Mantova." [Fascist era]
380. Rome. IX Quadriennale d'Arte Nazionale. Futurist paintings.
381. Rome. IX Quadriennale d'Arte Nazionale. Futurist paintings.
382. Rome. IX Quadriennale d'Arte Nazionale. Paintings by Peruzzi (property of FTM), Forlin (property of FTM) and other artists.

383. Art exhibition showing the works of Gerardo Dottori. Typescript on verso: "Una parete delle tre sale dedicate alle realizzazioni del Regime (artista Gherardo [sic] Dottori)." [One wall of the three rooms dedicated to the reali- zations of the Regime (artist Gerardo Dottori.] [Fascist era]
384. Art exhibition showing the works of Gerardo Dottori. Typescript on verso: "Una parete delle tre sale dedicate alle realizzazioni del Regime (artista Gerardo Dottori)."
385. Art exhibition showing the works of Gerardo Dottori. [presumably the same exhibition seen in n. 383 and n. 384.] Inscribed on verso: "Grande Polittico del Fascisme...Gerardo Dottori futurista."
386. Padua. Display windows of the Menin hat shop with a Futurist painting [by Balla?] and a sign that reads: "Futurismo Concorso Marinetti." Inscribed on verso: "Vetrina della Ditta Menin a Padova."
387. Three constructivist paintings. Inscribed on verso: "Vordemberge - Gildewart, Hannover, Listerstr. 24."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This section consists of photographs made by Futurist photographic artists, arranged in alphabetical order by photographer, followed by those works whose photographer is unknown.

did.unittitle: 388. Albergamo? Aerial photo. [Anne Coffin Hanson notes the photographer may be Albergamo or Tato. LMB indicates Albergamo.]
389. Castagneri, Mario. Portrait of FTM (with cut- paper abstractions), Milan, 1928. Signed and dated lower right.
390. Castagneri, Mario. Portrait of FTM and 2 unidentified men posed in profile at an exhibition.
391. Castagneri, Mario. Painting by Rodolfo Tonino DeAngelis. [See: Box 52, folder 1967]

392. Castagneri, Mario. The Futurist Group . Design of the photo layout by Depero. Left to right: Jannelli, Depero, Prampolini, Azari, Bisi, FTM, Lescovic, Casavola, Pinna, Somenzi, Russolo, Vianello (to the right of Russolo), Paoca, Mazza. Inscribed on verso are the names of 12 of the 14 men. [Giovanni Lista, in Futurismo e fotografia (1979) reproduces this photo and names all 14. This photo was made on the occasion of the first Italian Futurist Congress. See below.]

393. Castagneri, Mario. Group photo on the occasion of the first Futurist Congress, Milan. FTM, BMC, Paolo Buzzi, Armando Mazza, Luigi Russolo (far left), Mino Somenzi (in a Futurist waist coat) at the banquet for the first Italian fururist Congress. Inscribed at bottom of photo: "23 Novembre 1924 Onoranze nazionale a F.T. Marinetti animatore d'Italianita 1 Congresso Futuristi Italiano." [For a discussion of the event, See: Mino Somenzi, Difendo il futurismo (1938). Reproduced in Photographic futuriste Italianne , Paris, 1981, n. 33] Life of FTM," 1924, November 23.]

394. D'Albisola, Tullio? (pseud. of Tullio Spartaco Mazzotti). Photomontage of Giuseppe Mazzotti and FTM. Mazzotti was a manufacturer of ceramics. The photo- grapher probably was Mazzotti's son, Tullio D'Albisola, who, although best-known as a ceramicist, did experimental photography in the 1930's. Typescript on verso: "S. Ecc. F.T. Marinetti col vasaio Cav. G. Mazzotti, Albisola Estate 1938." 1938 Summer

395. Demanins, Ferruccio. FTM in a group. Trieste. Bruno G. Sanzin is to the right of the woman with her purse under her arm. [Demanins joined the Futurist movement in 1932 on the occasion of the Futurist photography exhibition in Trieste. At that event FTM spoke on Trieste radio about parole-in-libertà . See: Sotheby's Futurist Photography catalogue, 1982.] 1932?
396. Demanins, Ferruccio. FTM with 4 men and a woman. Trieste. Bruno G. Sanzin is leaning over FTM. [See: reference information above.] 1932?

397. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni). Marinetti - ritratto dinamico . Signed in pencil on verso, and inscribed on verso: "Marinetti declamatore." [See: Mostra fotografica futurista (ceramiche) catalogue, Trieste, 1932.]
398. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni). Mechanical portrait of the Futurist poet Remo Chiti , 1930. Signed in pencil on verso. [See: Sotheby's catalogue, Italian Futurist Photographs , 1982, n. 63.]

399. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni). Il Perfetto Borghese (camuffamento d'oggetti ), 1930. Title in- scribed on verso. Signed in pencil on verso. [See: Sotheby's catalogue, Italian Futurist Photographs , 1982, n. 59, and See: Giovanni Lista, Futurismo e Fotografia , 1979, p. 220, and See: Giovanni Lista, Photographie Futuriste Italienne 1911-1939 , 1982, n. 121.]

400. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni). Spirit portrait of the Futurist Mario Carli , 1930. Signed on verso. [See: Sotheby's catalogue, Italian Futurist Photographs , 1982, n. 65, and See: Giovanni Lista, Futurismo e Fotografia , 1979, p. 104, and See: Giovanni Lista, Photographie Futuriste Italienne 1911-1939 , 1982, n. 126.]

401. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni). Pastore con somarello [Shepherd with Donkey], 1930. Signed on verso. [See: Sotheby's catalogue, Italian Futurist Photographs , 1982, n. 60, and See: Giovanni Lista, Futurismo e Fotografia , 1979, p. 218, and See: Giovanni Lista, Photographie Futuriste Italienne 1911-1939 , 1982, n. 122.]
402. Photographer unknown. Photomontage. FTM speaking. Inscribed on verso: "fotodinamico."
403. Photographer unknown. Photomontage. FTM and the Futurist group of Macerata. Photo processed by S. Accorroni, Macerata. Dated 1933 by Giovanni Lista in Futurismo e fotografia (1979).
406. Balla, Giacomo (or his daughter). Portrait of Jannelli (painting). Inscribed on verso: "ricambia a Paolo Buzzi cordialissimi auguri per il nuovo anno gennaio 1942."
407. Boccioni, Umberto. Development of a Bottle in Space (sculpture). 1912. Collection Museu de Arte Contemporanea da Universidade de Sao Paulo. Typescript of museum cataloguing information on verso.
408. Boccioni, Umberto. A Futurist Soirée (drawing). Left to right: Boccioni, Pratella, FTM, Carra and Russolo.
410. Crali, Tullio. Prima che si apra il paracadute (painting). Exhibited in the XXII Esposizione Inter- nazionale d'Arte, Venice. Postcard.
413. Forlin, Corrado. Il Duce (sculpture). 23 April 1937. Inscribed on verso: " Il Duce Potero metterlo in una posa pui virile, vero? [illegible] Corrado Forlin del gruppo Savoie 23 A[pri]le XV."
414. Gutnayer, J. (architect). Drawing of a house. Inscribed and signed on recto and verso. Stamped on verso.
417. Pancera, G.?. Portrait of Paolo Buzzi (sculpture). 1952-53. Inscribed on verso.
419. Plinio, Verossi. L'Aviazione (painting), 1942?. Exhibited at the XXIII Esposizione Internazionale d'Arte de Venezia. Inscribed on verso: "Scalone S. Bartolomeo 1, Verona."
420. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni). Il Lavoro (painting). Formerly in the collection of the Confederazione fascista lavoro e industria. Inscribed in blue pencil on verso.

421. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni). L'Assalto (painting), ("fantasia decorativa per l'alcova dell'ardito Mario Carli") [decorative fantasy for the bedroom of the "ardito" Mario Carli.] Postcard made for the Esposizione Internazionale di Venezia, 1926, by the Movimento Futurista Italiano.
422. Tato (pseud. of Guglielmo Sansoni). La Festa dei Gagliardetti (painting), ("Fantasia futurfascista"). Postcard published by the Movimento Futurista Italiano.

424. Tosato, F. and de Giorgio. Architectural ren- dering of a hotel. Signed by di Giorgio on recto. Inscribed by de Giorgio on verso: "Con l'ing. Tosato sono capo gruppo degli urbanisti Padovani tutti passatisti che si stanno convincendo. I piu devoti saluti, de Giorgio." Postcard.
425. Artist unknown. FTM's profile superimposed on an aerial view (painting). Postcard.
OTHER POSTCARDS AND PHOTOS/WITHOUT FTM OR FUTURISTS
426. Gulf of Catania. Crowd of sailors and civilians. Inscribed on verso: "Gazeta de Mo."
427. Pietrasanto (Tuscany). Unident- ified people on the beach at this bathing resort on the Ligurian sea. Postcard. [Removed from Marinetti M977C.]
428. Maramures, Rumania. Chapel. Inscribed on verso: "Chapelle en bois en Maramures."
Articles from periodicals that refer to Futurism

scopecontent.p: Includes: 1. Fortunato Bellonzi, "Vitalità del futurismo," Via dell'Impero [?]
2. Vittorio Orazi, "Nuovi avviamenti della poesia italiana e loro cause," Via dell'Impero [?]
3. Corrado Govoni, "Marinetti, poète," La Phalange (Paris), année 10, n. 17, 15 April 1937.
4. Col. Basseggio, "L'adunata di Piazza S. Sepolcro," periodical unknown
5. Jean Brzekowski, "Le Futurisme italien en Pologne," periodical unknown

did.unittitle: Pages clipped from Latinité (Paris), année 3, n. 9, Sept. 1931 (with pencil markings, by FTM?)
1. pp. 12-20 from Gonzague Truc, "Entretiens d'outre-tombe; Platon ou des idées."
Issues (some not complete) of non-Italian newspapers with articles, photos, and/or cartoons that refer to Futurism:
Clippings from newspapers and periodicals that refer to World War I
Clippings from newspapers that refer to the death of F.T. Marinetti
FTM's address books (3) and loose sheets with hand- written addresses
Proof-sheets for a Futurist exhibition catalogue with manuscript corrections

Publishers' prospectuses Includes: BCM, Astra e il Sottomarino BCM, Viaggio di Gararà FTM, Spagna Veloce and Toro Futurista FTM, Il Poema Africano della Divisione '28 Ottobre' FTM, L'Aeropoema del Golfo della Spezia FTM, O Oriente [with photograph of FTM] FTM, La Ville Charnelle and Les Dieux S'en Vont - D'Annunzio Reste FTM, Mondadori editions of various works

Publicity broadsides Includes: "La vittoria dei Futuristi" (for Poesia "Schiaffi, Pugni e Quadri Futuristi" (for Il Futurismo ) "Paolo Buzzi glorificato nella battaglia di Roma e nel Banchetto ai futuristi" and "Il poeta futurista Luciano Folgore" by Arturo Calza (for I Poeti Futuristi
Carteggio sottoscrittori. March, 1934 List of contributors to a gift of an automobile for FTM on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of Futurism
Theatre box-office receipts and author's royalties accounts.
Contract and other materials concerning FTM's South American lecture tour, 1926.
Itinerary for FTM's visit to Morocco, Nov 1932.
PNF [Fascist Party] membership and convention cards
Istituto Editoriale del Littorio. Roma 1 item stock certificate [?] Signed by Settimelli and Mario Carli
Partial register of people attending FTM's funeral [?] 6 p.
Manuscript inscriptions to FTM from other authors Includes: Virgil Huzum, 1930; Carlos Ibarguren, 1936; and unidentified, n.d. 4 items
Floor plan of Casa Colonica 1 item
Invitation to a lecture on the literary activity of Benedetta, 1936. 1 item
Statuto della Società Anonima Cooperativa 16-page typescript. [signed by D. Stefan?]
Printed items that refer to World War I. 1918, n.d. 6 items
La Fortuna , Giornale dei dilettanti del lotto (Velletri), anno XXVII, n. 311, Feb 1918. 1 item
Sheet music dedicated to FTM and BCM Includes: V. Mortari, "Teatro della Sorpresa" F. Bochen, "Preludio Satirico" Silvio Mix, "Profilo Sintetico-Musicale" 6 items
X-rays of FTM's head. Envelope from the Istituto di Radiologia, Rome, 1940. 2 items
Notes by BCM found removed from books catalogued in the Marinetti collection 5 items
Press release from Agencia A.L.A. 1938 Jun 8
Press release: "La Nuova Direzione del Movimento Futurista Italiana" with typescript carbon list of "Futuristi Volantari per l'Africa Orientale" (printed in La Forza Aug 30 1935)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains oversize items from Series III, IV, V, IX and X.

did.unittitle: Letters to and about Filippo Tommaso Marinetti

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1905 Oct 4 3 p. In French, all pages glued together to make one sheet; "Corsivo 10" written in blue pencil, in hand of FTM?

did.unittitle: Ancora una volta 'Guerra sola igiene del mondo'
Printed version (as "1926 in Francia: Assemblea di donne"), La Gazzetta del Popolo - Torino 1940 Oct 13
I Diritti artistici, propugnati dai futuristi italiani. Manifesto al governo fascista
Printed manifesto, with a note in upper left corner from FTM to an unidentified "Carissimo" asking for his opinion. Notes in pencil, in an unidentified hand on pp. 1-4 (in red pencil on p. 3). 4 p.
"Italiani liberatevi dalle abitudini inglesi: manifesto futurista"
Excerpt, printed version, Gazzetta del Popolo
"Il Paesaggio nei sentimenti e nelle poesie di Napoli"
Autograph manuscript signed on last page. 22 p.
Printed version (as "Manifeste de la Radia Futuriste"), Comoedia
Page 38 bis of proof of the French version. With corrections, unpublished.

"Aeropoesia per Aeropittura", autograph manuscript poem, with underlining in various colors and corr- ections in the same hand. Signed at the bottom of the last page and dated Rome, 2 Jan 1938, "Mostra d'Aeropittura futurista". 5 p.
"Golfo di Napoli", autograph manuscript poem with title, underlining and asterisks in red. Signed on last page and dated Milan 1936. 20 p.
"Stornellata Ditirambica", autograph manuscript poem, with notations and additions in the same hand. Signed at the bottom of the last page and dated Milan, Jul 1937. 11 p.

"Ossecorp la Noub Osnes", typescript carbon of a play, dedicated to FTM, and signed on the last page. Dedication in manuscript on page [1]. Also a second copy, in proof form, with no corrections, but with "Bragagia" written in FTM's hand on the first page 37 p., numbered [1]-23 and [1]-8.
Le Forze Umane , publicity broadside, titled "Una Nuova Scrittrice Futurista" by Paolo Buzzi
"Tuberie", autograph manuscript poem, signed at the top of page 1. 6 p., numbered 1-6.
"Medium", autograph manuscript poem, in Italian, signed. "c. 12" written in blue pencil at top; probably published in Poesia . 1 p.
